programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Cathy Bradford has her 15 minutes of fame, appearing on TV with Lorraine Kelly to talk about how she was betrayed by best friend Polly Page, but Superintendent Okaro takes a dim view of the publicity stunt, leaving the psychotic cop with an uncertain future at Sun Hill. The working relationship between June Ackland and Gabriel Kent takes an unexpected turn when she breaks down in front of him

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Racial tensions rise in Sun Hill, and Adam Okaro is under pressure to placate both a local community leader and a National Party councillor. Gabriel Kent offers June Ackland a shoulder to cry on, and is quick to turn on the charm when they pose as a couple in an undercover operation, while Phil Hunter struggles to focus at work, and admits he and Cindy are undergoing IVF treatment

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New DC Terry Perkins arrives to implement a unit designed to manage dangerous offenders released back into the community, and he's immediately thrown into the thick of things when a known paedophile is seen handing over cash to a schoolgirl. Meanwhile, Phil Hunter gets much more than he bargained for when he investigates a boxer who's taken a beating outside the ring

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Hospital staff come under suspicion when an elderly patient's house is burgled using the keys in her bedside cabinet - until a discrepancy over the amount of money stolen puts someone else in the frame. Terry Perkins and Eva Sharpe try different approaches in dealing with paedophile Ian Forrester, and Honey Harman makes a shocking discovery about an intruder at Tony Stamp's house - but that's nothing compared to the surprise awaiting Tony

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Phil Hunter and Eva Sharpe follow separate lines of inquiry when a prostitute is stabbed, and although Eva's investigation uncovers the perpetrator, Phil is quick to take the credit. Nick Klein is angered by the sergeant's behaviour, so he puts in a call to his wife. Meanwhile, Jim Carver is embarrassed when Marie is brought in on a charge of being drunk and disorderly

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel, starring Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha. A wealthy eligible bachelor rents a property in Hertfordshire, causing a flurry of anticipation among the ladies of the district. However, it transpires he also brought along a friend - the haughty and aloof Fitzwilliam Darcy

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Mrs Bennet spots an opportunity to marry off another of her daughters with the arrival of clergyman Mr Collins. However, Elizabeth is unable to take his proposal seriously, being too preoccupied with a handsome newcomer who poisons her mind further against Mr Darcy. Alison Steadman, Jennifer Ehle and David Bamber star in Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Elizabeth visits Mr Collins once Charlotte has accepted his proposal of marriage and confides in Jane that she regards him as one of the stupidest men in England. Mrs Bennet sizes up George Wickham as a potential suitor for her daughter - but he has set his heart on society heiress Miss King

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Rejected by Elizabeth, Darcy decides to return to Rosling Park - and resolves to reveal the truth about Wickham's character in a letter. Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha star

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Despite Miss Bingley's efforts to keep them apart, Darcy and Elizabeth's relationship grows more affectionate - until bad news arrives from Longbourn about Lydia and Wickham. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Jennifer Ehle, Colin Firth and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Wickham's elopement with Lydia makes Elizabeth see him for what he really is, while Bingley proposes to Jane - an offer she readily accepts. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner and Sister Hilda are both bewildered and concerned by a patient's unexplained symptoms, and try to get to the bottom of her ill health before it impacts her pregnancy. A woman expecting her third child is worried about her recent weight gain and turns to Lucille for support, leading to an unexpected discovery

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: After an unidentified burnt body is found near an RAF base, Gently works alongside Special Branch officers who suspect the victim was involved with the IRA. However, the discovery that a large cache of guns has gone missing turns the case into a hostage situation. Feature-length episode starring Martin Shaw as the 1960s Northumberland detective, with Lee Ingleby and Robert Glenister

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The duo investigate the case of a glamorous beautician accused of killing her former lover, a plastic surgeon who had threatened to ruin the launch of her new book

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A veteran comedian is found dead in a sealed fallout shelter. Locked from the inside of the concrete bunker with no other means of exit, all clues point to suicide, but Maddy Magellan thinks otherwise and calls on the services of professional illusionist Jonathan Creek

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Glamorous opera singer Eleanor Samson becomes the prime suspect in a murder case after her estranged husband's lover is found in the burnt-out shell of a boat. Taggart's assistant Peter Livingstone believes Eleanor is guilty, but the grizzled detective's instincts suggest otherwise. Crime drama, guest starring Isla Blair with Mark McManus and Neil Duncan

programme.desc: Mac endeavours to tackle the problems of a country singer whose sore throat threatens both her career and marriage, and tries to soothe the fears of a barber facing an equally bleak future

programme.desc: Alfie pays tribute to Kat, who still has feelings for him. Troubled couple Garry and Lynne reach an understanding

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Joseph makes a shocking discovery, abruptly ending the sisters' excitement about the new clothing deal

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Left to look after Felsham Hall until it has been sold, Lovejoy uses the house as a furniture showroom. It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Life in Cardale is shaken up by the arrival of sultry nurse Claire Brightwell, who is bound to set a few pulses racing with her bright and breezy bedside manner. Meanwhile, Tom and two other rock climbers are involved in a cliff-face accident with unexpected ramifications, and Will gets a shock to see his son Tony again _ but that's just the start of the surprises. Popular medical drama, starring Simon Shepherd, Gray O'Brien, Maggie O'Neill and Eva Pope

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Tom sets out to prove himself by learning to drive and Harvey again applies for membership of the golf club, masquerading as a clergyman. Sitcom set in the Bayview Retirement Village, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity prompts communist partisans to capture the disguised airmen, leaving Rene to mastermind a rescue bid before all manner of mayhem breaks loose. Comedy written by Jeremy Lloyd and David Croft, starring Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Part one of two. Compo yearns to reach for the skies in a hang-glider to impress Nora Batty, but finds a challenge to climb a tree more than enough to handle. Meanwhile, the object of his affections pesters Wally to take her out for a meal. Long-running comedy set in rural Yorkshire, starring Bill Owen and Kathy Staff

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Part two of two. Wally finishes the hang-glider and declares that it is ready to be tested, so Compo steps into the frey. Long-running comedy set in rural Yorkshire, starring Bill Owen and Kathy Staff

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Mike and Beth take a long road trip to obtain divorce papers from his ex-wife, and Kristin and Daniel contend with the mysterious death of a man in a hotel room. Detective drama, starring Neill Rea

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The daughter of a man held responsible for a fatal boating accident on the Thames comes forward with new evidence, claiming that a property developer sabotaged the vessel. The case means putting Strickland's wealthy sailing friends under the spotlight, much to the team's delight. Guest starring Barbara Flynn (Cranford)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki and Jack are called to a petrol station where three people have been shot dead, and conclude it is the work of a concealed shooter working from long range - a sniper is at large in London. They combine ballistics and wound pathology with the killer-profiling skills of senior investigator DCI Jane De Freitas, as they work to find this seemingly random murderer before panic hits the city. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Zoe Telford and Steve Wall

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: The police investigate a huge hole that has been excavated, and Larry Bishop's invisible dogs have disappeared. Meanwhile, Andy and Lance have one last chance to pursue their hearts' desires. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones

programme.desc: While reseaching her book on prisons, Dorien meets an incarcerated Chris on a visit to the Isle of Wight, and is promptly taken in by his criticisms of Sharon as a bad wife. Comedy, starring Lesley Joseph, Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Mac's jealousy is aroused by the discovery that Rana and Steve have a stunning admirer, and tongues wag over what he did to upset Helen. Meanwhile, Anoushka and Ruth do some investigating

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Anoushka visits a dying friend, while Kate sets out to catch the person responsible for stealing biscuits from the staff room. Meanwhile, twins with a penchant for gambling accompany their ailing mother to the surgery. Christopher Timothy and Jacqueline Leonard star

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ollie tries to shut Tara out when they work together on a sensitive case, leading to an argument that threatens his professional standing and his duty of care to a teenager struggling to accept his mother is dying. She thinks she has found a kindred spirit in rebellious old patient Vincent - until he angers her by refusing the surgery he so desperately needs. Ron Moody (Oliver!) guest stars in the medical drama

programme.desc: Kat confides in Nana that she still loves Alfie. Sharon resolves to find out what Den is up to

Meanwhile, newcomer Beth Taylor gives Eric and Tinker a helping hand. Ian McShane stars

Rural medical drama, starring Simon Shepherd and Gray O'Brien

programme.desc: Diana watches calmly as Tom completes a bungee jump, and Harvey is informed that any preaching he does will be grounds for fraud charges. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole

programme.desc: Rene reluctantly assists the Resistance as they set out to blow up a railway line, but the mission is jeopardised when Edith mistakes the explosives for gin. Meanwhile, a plane from London supposedly transporting German uniforms turns out to contain a tailor

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg and Compo discover Foggy thinks they should devote themselves to first aid, after a life-saving attempt ends in a drenching

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Clegg and Compo try to make Sid appear dashing in Ivy's eyes, convincing Weasley to use him in his latest experiment. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde, John Comer and Gordon Wharmby

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A housewife dies of chemical poisoning during her weekly shopping trip and the detectives immediately suspect they have a case of terrorism on their hands, However, a second death points them toward a health retreat with a troubled past and a mysterious woman named Barbara Lennox. Stephen Tompkinson guest stars

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry is forced to confront his past when the team reinvestigates the 33-year-old murder of a doctor whose body was found hanging from a meat hook on a butcher's stall at Smithfield Market. The butcher had gone missing on the same day, and since then the community has rallied to help his widow keep the business afloat. However, his recently discovered remains reveal a match to an unidentified person and lead to a shocking revelation for Sandra. Guest starring Ken Farrington, David Calder and Diana Quick, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. Nikki and Jack investigate when a man is run down and killed by a Tube train - although not long after, a female vicar is murdered on the Underground, leaving them with the difficult prospect of building a case against her distraught husband. However, when a young roofer is stalked and brutally killed on his journey home, CCTV cameras pick up a suspect who links the deaths, and a full-scale manhunt is launched. Meanwhile, Nikki forms a bond with one of the detectives, who asks her to help re-evaluate his father's murder when he was a child. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: The return of Mackenzie Crook's award-winning comedy in which he and Toby Jones star as metal detector enthusiasts in search of their hearts' desire. Andy is considering internet dating. Not for him, but for Lance, who is still not over the departure of his ex-wife. Meanwhile, a mysterious stranger arrives to tempt the metal detecting club - in more ways than one. Real-life mother and daughter Diana Rigg and Rachael Stirling co-star, with Gerard Horan and Sophie Thompson

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of the second session of day two from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where the men's 100m takes centre-stage with semi-finals at 3.35 and the final at 6.10. The Americans dominated the sprint event last year on home territory in Eugene, with Fred Kerley narrowly defeating compatriots Marvin Bracy and Trayvon Bromell, but Great Britain's Zharnel Hughes will also hope to be in contention this time around after breaking Linford Christie's long-standing national record this year. The heptathlon concludes with the 800m at 5.00, and medals are also awarded in the women's long jump from 3.55, the men's hammer from 4.50 and the men's 10,000m at 5.25. Jeanette Kwakye presents, with analysis from Michael Johnson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt are in Nottinghamshire to help two teams look for items of value at the Newark Antiques Fair. Presenter Charlie Ross gets the lowdown on the resurgence of brown furniture, before the whole team heads to Derby for some auction action

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers are matchmaking for Zuri the fennec fox who has been historically unlucky in love and take a big step forward in the antelope breeding programme. Hamza Yassin takes on legendary park keeper Ian Turner in a photography competition and tries to get some laughs out of the lions while Megan McCubbin helps with an experiment to provide fresh food all year round for the African colobus monkeys

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of Turner, one of Britain's most loved artists, Rick discovers how much the Cornish landscape influenced his work. At Newlyn Fish Market, he counts in the daily catch with the head auctioneer, who tells him how the market has adapted to modern times, while at Caerhays Castle, home to the nation's largest collection of magnolia plants, Rick discovers how this corner of Cornwall was once home to some of the great Victorian plant hunters

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah explores Arundel in West Sussex, in her quest for the ideal location as her buyers seek the right place to spend their £900,000 on. She hands over the keys to some surprising houses, but will her self-confessed 'instant buyers' decide to seal the deal on any of them?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Expert Pete Woods meets John who brings in a trumpet that was gifted to him by his grandfather Frank who played it in an army band during the Second World War. John is hoping Pete can repair the instrument so he can start teaching his own grandson to play, the same way his grandad taught him. Claire brings in a delicately painted wardrobe given to her great grandparents to celebrate their marriage. Wood restorer Will Kirk tries to save the broken cupboard which is completely missing a back board and internal shelves. The final visitor to the barn is Jane who brings in a rickety old ironing board for the attention of Dominic Chinea that reminds her of the time her and her husband couldn't afford a home and lived in a squat

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki and Stacey come together to help Eve but Theo's meddling doesn't help. Things go wrong for Patrick when Yolande's ex-lover Anton arrives and Phil continues to put pressure on Alfie. A familiar face returns to the square

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Further live coverage of day four from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are awarded in the women's 1500m at 8.30 and the men's 3,000m steeplechase at 8.42. Great Britain's Laura Muir will be looking to build on her 1500m bronze medal at last year's championships in Eugene, while reigning world and Olympic title holder Soufiane El Bakkali could again be the man to beat in the steeplechase

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Actors Amy Walsh and Michael Praed, rapper and philanthropist Apl.de.Ap, dancer Dianne Buswell and reality star Luca Bish compete in the final week of heats. Faced first with the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient to incorporate into a meal for judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace before preparing their Dinner Party Dishes

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Boot Dreams: Now or Never
programme.desc: Roman Kemp presents a documentary following young footballers rejected by top clubs as they get a second chance through a unique camp at Manchester City's former training ground, under the watchful eye of former premier league player Gifton Noel-Williams. The first episode features a training match against Manchester International Football Academy

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Paralympic legend Hannah Cockroft, former Premier League striker Clinton Morrison, Great Britain sprinter Desiree Henry and sports broadcaster Nat Coombs join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants for pollinators in the wildlife garden, takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer vegetable harvest. Carol Klein visits Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire and Rekha Mistry reveals the latest triumphs and disasters in her new garden in the Peak District

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Hamza Yassin are in Renfrewshire, joined by Edith Bowman, who will be the judge of this year's entries to the Countryfile photographic competition. John also meets Cyanotype artist Martha Orbach to uncover the origins of nature photography and visits a Glaswegian community collective. Hamza reveals a simple butterfly feeder to support wildlife, and Adam Henson has some tough decisions over what to grow after harvest

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of day two from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where the heptathlon continues with the long jump from 8.50 and the javelin from 11.00. There is also action on the track in the form of heats for the women's 400m at 8.35, the men's 400m at 8.25, the men's 400m hurdles at 10.25, the women's 100m at 11.10, and the men's 110 m hurdles at 12.05

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones travels through the South Wales Valleys with BBC Radio Wales' Roy Noble, meeting locals and uncovering stories of the region's history of Christian faith and revival

programme.title: Shadowlands (1993)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the later life of novelist CS Lewis, detailing how he fell in love with American poet Joy Gresham, only to see his new-found happiness marred by tragedy and illness. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger, Edward Hardwicke, John Wood, Michael Denison and Joseph Mazzello

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and Thomas Plant value antiques at the Fleet Air Arm Museum in Yeovilton, Somerset, while Paul Martin finds out about one of Europe's largest helicopter squadrons

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Today, Earth is home to eight billion people and counting, with humans now having a greater effect in shaping Earth's surface than many natural processes. Chris Packham explores how dramatic twists in Earth's story enabled humans to go from being part of nature to controlling it and what can be learnt from this epic tale before it's too late

programme.title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel (2015)
programme.desc: With the original Best Exotic Marigold Hotel a roaring success, owner Sonny decides the time is right to expand his business empire. But to do so, he and the rest of the residents must pull out all the stops to impress a potential investor's inspector - a task that proves to be easier said than done. Comedy drama sequel, with Dev Patel, Maggie Smith, Judi Dench and Richard Gere

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder go behind the scenes at Nusfjord Arctic Resort, a preserved 200-year-old cod-fishing village in the Lofoten Islands of Norway. Working alongside the dedicated staff, Monica and Rob learn to appreciate the difficulties of running a high-end resort in such an extreme environment as they battle snowy paths with housekeeping, face huge waves on fishing boats and chase the Northern Lights

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: Georgie assures her fellow brokers that she has clients who are interested in a beautiful country house, but where does it leave her when the potential buyers don't even show up? Vanesa didn't get any offers from her open house in Monaco and is now worried that her mother is going to cut her off, while Krish is not convinced about working in London and meets up with an old contact from Leicester. The millionaire entrepreneur is looking for a new family home, but he has a very specific list of criteria and is refusing to share exactly what they are with Krish

programme.title: The Power of the Dog (2021)
programme.desc: In 1925, wealthy Montana ranch-owner Phil Burbank inspires fear and awe in those around him. When his brother George brings a new wife and her teenage son to live at their homestead, Phil torments them - until he finds himself exposed to the possibility of love. Jane Campion's Western, starring Benedict Cumberbatch, Kirsten Dunst and Jesse Plemons

programme.title: Looted (2019)
programme.desc: Rob lives his life at 100mph, carefully balancing carjacking schemes and caring for his dying father in the cash-starved port town he calls home. But one risky job could bring it all crashing down. Crime drama, starring Charley Palmer Rothwell, Thomas Turgoose and Tom Fisher

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A creepy gift from Penderecki sets Jack off in a new direction. He negotiates with the Walking Man for more information, but he won't budge until Jack has found Bear's home. He warns Jack of people in the woods who don't take kindly to police. Honey takes control of his predicament following a visit from the police, only to find it is too late and that his troubles are only just beginning

programme.title: Henpocalypse!
programme.desc: Zara and her bridal party leave their Birmingham council estate for a messy hen do in an isolated Welsh cottage - only for their fun to be derailed by the end of the world. With food running out and zero survival skills to call on, the hens are forced to break quarantine and venture into post-apocalyptic Snowdonia. Comedy, starring Lucie Shorthouse, Elizabeth Berrington, Callie Cooke, Lauren O'Rourke and Kate O'Flynn

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Calum Clunie reap the results of the planting from earlier in the year. The windowsill tomatoes are in full fruit and Carole harvests the blooms planted in the spring to be dried and used for flower arrangements. Calum sows a selection of vegetables ready for the winter and there's a report from a community garden in the Cranhill area of Glasgow

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble provide an update on Bart the capybara as he is introduced to a new mate. Plus, Kate heads to Koala Creek to be introduced to a bettong and a long-nosed potoroo, two species that have been badly affected by the Australian wild fires but now play a vital role in the recovery of those forests

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive's Italian adventure continues with visits to Verona, Treviso, Lake Garda and the village of Limone, along the way learning how to make tiramisu and finding out how the balcony inspired by Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet now brings lovers from all over the world. He also meets up with an old friend and learns why Italians live some of the longest lives in Europe

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Warwickshire, where he gets a glimpse of the work being done for the new HS2 railway infrastructure. In Stratford-upon-Avon he learns about the founding of the Royal Shakespeare Company, before a visit to Birmingham, where he recalls the redevelopment of the city centre during the 1960s and the arrival of black and Asian communities

programme.title: Nicky Campbell

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the third semi-final of the quiz, with four more returning contenders answering questions on specialist subjects of the films of Powell and Pressburger, the Bauhaus movement, Emil Zatopek, and the Liberal Democrats, before they each are teted on their general knowledge

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Former legal director John Owens and property manager Julie Petford face each other in a bid to make the most profit and be crowned the winner in Stratford-upon-Avon

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Clarks see the harsh reality of poaching in Indonesia when they visit tigers that were caught in snares, prompting Giles to concoct an ambitious plan to save the injured big cats in the wild. Back in Australia, Spot and Stripe are days away from their first birthday and will no longer be classed as cubs, while Spot faces an operation that may end with him losing all vision

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo looks at files from the National Archives that relate to the monarchy, unearthing a speech that would have been read by the Queen in the event of the Third World War breaking out. He also examines the fabulous wealth of a tragic king and reveals the nine lives of Queen Victoria

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Claire Rawle value items at De Montfort Hall in Leicester, while presenter Paul Martin reveals how local radio has its origins in the East Midlands city

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of day three from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, including the final of the men's triple jump from 6.40. Portugal's Pedro Richardo is the man to beat, having won this title in Eugene last year and also taken Olympic gold in Tokyo. The men's 400m hurdles semi-finals also take place at 5.50

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Ben Robinson visits Laxey on the Isle of Man to discover what drew Victorians to the tourist destination. It wasn't the beaches and the mountains that attracted Victorian tourists, but an engineering marvel - the biggest waterwheel in the world

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as former Mastermind contenders the Also Rans take on family team the Gardners. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Catalonia, China, MCC, and Lifeguard on duty

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Amol Rajan asks the questions in another first-round match, with four students from King's College, Cambridge pitting their wits against a team from University College London in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition

programme.title: Dara O Briain: So Where Were We?
programme.desc: A 2022 stand-up performance by the comedian at Dublin's Vicar Street venue, in which talks about dealing with missing body parts, a TV show he'll never do and an astonishing family revelation

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Over a gourmet meal of pork chop, chips, beans and tea, the subject under discussion yet again is Denise's impending wedding. Jim grumbles non-stop about having to foot the entire bill, because the groom's father has been on disability for 12 years. Denise, meanwhile, thinks Dave is not interested enough in the wedding. Comedy, starring Ricky Tomlinson, Sue Johnston, Caroline Aherne, Craig Cash and Ralf Little. First broadcast in 1998

programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Mark Urban

programme.title: The Elephant Man (1980)
programme.desc: In 1884, ambitious young surgeon Frederick Treves is intrigued by a sideshow freak billed as the Elephant Man. He finds, behind the disfigured exhibit, an intelligent person called John Merrick, whose rehabilitation he undertakes, with the severely deformed man's life being transformed by the friendship that develops between the two. Fact-based drama directed by David Lynch, starring John Hurt, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller and Freddie Jones

programme.desc: John Craven and Hamza Yassin are in Renfrewshire, joined by Edith Bowman, who will be the judge of this year's entries to the Countryfile photographic competition. programme.title: Impossible

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin is in Dorset as driving instructor Helen Adams and former flight attendant Yvonne Johnson use their own cash to buy and sell antiques to try to make the most profit

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chris McClurg, Alex Greene and Glen Wheeler make their way to the kitchen for the Northern Ireland heats, preparing their starters and fish courses. For his starter, Chris presents a refined take a classic lamb-based takeaway, while Alex opts for a dish compromising of the key flavours of a traditional British breakfast. For his fish course, Glen decides to showcase john dory

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his search through the National Archives, unearthing files outlining the state's strategy on Scientology, exploring how bull running was outlawed in Britain, and taking a look at pictures by John Lennon that were banned

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antiques experts Claire Rawle and Adam Partridge appraise collectables that reflect local Kent character at Chiddingstone Castle. Meanwhile, presenter Paul Martin visits Anne Boleyn's family home of Hever Castle to reveal what influenced her rise to power

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of day four from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where the men's high jump final gets under way at 6.55 and the women's discus at 7.20. Qatar's Mutaz Essa Barshim is the reigning high jump champion after clearing 2.37m last year in Eugene, and Feng Bin of China's 69.12m was enough to prevail in the discus. On the track, heats take place in the women's 100m hurdles and men's 800m at 5.40 and 6.20 respectively

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Retired couple Liz and Paul from Norwich reach out to Angela Scanlon for help redesigning their three-bed home that has become unmanageable for Liz who has a degenerative bone disease. Architects Lynsey Elliott and Damion Burrows create their own designs to make the home perfect for the couple and allow them to see what it would look like using virtual reality and visual effects to help them decide which one to choose. Lynsey blows the pair away with her wedge-shaped extension but Damion's joyous bright colour scheme brings Paul to tears

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: It comes down to the wire as the planners battle to impress the judges and pull off a millionaire's garden party for Lauren and Jodie

programme.title: Henpocalypse!
programme.desc: The hens face an unpleasant surprise in a mini-mart in Snowdownia and mother-of-the-bride Bernadette tries to turn the situation to their advantage. In an hour of need, one of the hens receives help from a national treasure

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Northern Soul (2014)
programme.desc: A teenager living in a Northern town in the 1970s finds his horizons expanded when he discovers American soul music. He develops an inseparable friendship with a fellow devotee and the pair hope to achieve a brighter future beyond their bleak daily life. Drama, starring Elliot James Langridge, Josh Whitehouse, Steve Coogan and Ricky Tomlinson

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A father and son involved in a police chase end up on the wrong side of the law after making bogus claims, and two riders have an unlikely crash on a deserted street in lockdown

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, searching for three items with the potential to be revived. She saves a pine chest of drawers for carpenter Martin Hough and a trio of utility chairs for upcycler Sarah Peterson. Sarah takes on a set of trestle table bases for her own project

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Drag artist Cheryl Hole, actor and singer Jamelia, musician Locksmith, former glamour model Sam Fox and opera singer Wynne Evans compete in the penultimate week of heats. Facing the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient they must incorporate into a dish to demonstrate their potential to judges Greg Wallace and John Torode. In a final attempt to impress, the contestants prepare their Dinner Party Dishes with hopes of not being the one person going home

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc: The natural world has always been a powerful inspiration to composers. From vast forests and tiny fish to wild storms and epic seascapes, this programme takes viewers on an evocative journey through some of the best-loved musical responses to the living planet. Including works by Vivaldi, Reiner, Vaughan Williams and Debussy

programme.title: Dame Janet Baker Sings
programme.desc: Mary Marquis introduces a concert recorded in the Queen's Hall, Edinburgh in 1981 with Dame Janet Baker, as she is joined by the Scottish Chamber Orchestra in a performance of Mendelssohn's concert aria Infelice and Handel's dramatic solo cantata Lucrezia

programme.title: NYO at the Proms
programme.desc: Soprano Masabane Cecilia Rangwanasha joins the National Youth Orchestra for a night of joyously defiant music. Strauss' Four Last Songs, considered by some the most beautiful music ever written, is played alongside Hindemith and Copland, all conducted by Carlos Miguel Prieto. Composer Errollyn Wallen debuts a new piece written especially for the orchestra's 2023 summer tour. Presented by Jess Gillam with special guests Alexis Ffrench and Vikki Stone

programme.title: Return of the Architect
programme.desc: Michael and Patty Hopkins, the architects responsible for the design of Glyndebourne Opera House, return to the scene of their creation eight years after its completion to see how their original concept has been developed

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Dr Jacob Bronowski explores the discoveries of Victorian naturalists Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel Wallace

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Dr Jacob Bronowski examines the history of ideas that led to the discovery of atoms, electrons and neutrons

programme.title: Janet Baker: In Her Own Words
programme.desc: The classical singer looks back on her life and career, discussing the traumatic death of her brother when she was 10 and how it influenced her voice, as well as her decision to retire from performance in her 50s. The programme features archive footage of some of her greatest stage roles and contributions from musicians including Andre Previn, in one of the last interviews recorded before his death

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: Mathematician Dr Hannah Fry is joined by actor Paul McGann and psychotherapist Philippa Perry to explore the technology, art and culture of the last years of Queen Victoria's reign. In the first episode, Hannah investigates how innovations in science and technology - including the X-ray, safety bicycle and proto-aeroplane - transformed Britain in the 1890s, with the end of the 19th century marking the beginning of a new 'Electric Age'

programme.title: Dame Janet Baker Sings
programme.desc: Mary Marquis introduces a concert recorded in the Queen's Hall, Edinburgh in 1981 with Dame Janet Baker, as she is joined by the Scottish Chamber Orchestra in a performance of Mendelssohn's concert aria Infelice and Handel's dramatic solo cantata Lucrezia

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo makes his way from Chicago to Champaign, Illinois. On his travels he discovers the origins of the Sanitary and Ship Canal, joins the head chef at Palmer House Hotel to recreate the original chocolate brownie, and visits the Frank Lloyd Wright-designed house that changed the face of American architecture

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In North Somerset, archaeologists are blown away by the discovery of an entirely new Roman town in the intended pathway of some new electricity cables. Multiple, impressive layers of road building from the Roman era are revealed, in particular a spectacular section from the fourth century when Emperor Constantine presided over a boom in Britain's economy. Elsewhere in Pembrokeshire, Alice Roberts revisits Whitesands Bay where a team are excavating a mysterious collection of child burials

programme.title: Oceans Apart: Art and the Pacific with James Fox
programme.desc: The art historian traces the effects of the West's contact with the peoples and cultures of the Pacific, beginning with the impact on the Aborigines of Captain Cook's arrival in Australia in 1770. He reveals how the indigenous people were almost destroyed by European colonisation, but held on to their art to survive, flourish and ultimately share their extraordinary culture with the world

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: In October 1917, the Bolsheviks rose up, swept the Russian tsar from power and communism was born. However, the exact facts of the Russian Revolution are disputed. Here, the historian finds it was really a group of women workers who kick-started the event nine months earlier. At the time, the Bolsheviks tried to stop it, and Lenin - radical leader of the Bolsheviks - wasn't even in the country. Lucy also discovers that the tsar was forced to abdicate long before the Bolsheviks took control and that King George V betrayed his cousin by opposing the British government's offer of asylum to the tsar

programme.title: Queen Victoria's Letters: A Monarch Unveiled
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part programme, biographer AN Wilson reveals the years after her beloved Prince Albert's death were actually a process of liberation and the most productive and exciting times for Queen Victoria. By examining her closest relationships in the four decades after Albert's death, Wilson tells the story of the Queen's gradual freedom from a life spent under the shadow of domineering men. Includes readings by Anna Chancellor

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: Actor Paul McGann explores the 1890s, a decade when science, entertainment, art and morality collided. He discovers how the works of HG Wells, Aubrey Beardsley and Oscar Wilde were shaped by fears of moral, social and racial degeneration, and explains how Wilde sought to subvert traditional Victorian values

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo makes his way from Chicago to Champaign, Illinois. On his travels he discovers the origins of the Sanitary and Ship Canal, joins the head chef at Palmer House Hotel to recreate the original chocolate brownie, and visits the Frank Lloyd Wright-designed house that changed the face of American architecture

programme.title: River Walks
programme.desc: Former Coronation Street star Shobna Gulati takes a stroll through Shropshire and Worcestershire along the banks of the Severn, Great Britain's longest river, finding out about a part of the country that is a world away from her native north-west England

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops at Mattoon, Illinois, where he gets a taste of the early life that shaped President Abraham Lincoln, though struggles to split one rail compared with Lincoln's estimated 700 a day. The political pundit then heads to Kentucky, where a bloody conflict proved decisive in victory for Lincoln's Union. Aboard a paddle steamer on the lower Mississippi, Michael hears about the life of former river boat captain Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain, and in Memphis, Tennessee, uncovers the story of a devastating epidemic. In the home of the Blues, Michael joins some Elvis fans at Graceland

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank and Betty travel to the seaside for a second honeymoon, hoping to make up for the catastrophes of the first. All seems to be going to plan - until they reach the hotel. Classic comedy, starring Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice. Originally broadcast in 1973

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Cutbacks to the civil service threaten the permanent secretary's position so Sir Humphrey tries to manipulate Hacker into abandoning his new policy. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola and Olly lock themselves away in a hotel room to try to finish preparing an important speech for the annual party conference. However, it is Glenn who hits the spot when he enlists the help of a local people's champion with a tragic tale. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Chris Addison

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: A look at the complex history and impact of grime music, from its DIY collaborative origins in London council estates and pirate radio to its complicated emergence into the mainstream, tracking its enormous influence and resonance along the way

programme.title: Rolling Stones: Crossfire Hurricane (2012)
programme.desc: Director Brett Morgen provides a new perspective on the Stones' unparalleled journey from blues-obsessed teenagers in the early '60s to rock royalty - a journey from the Marquee Club to Hyde Park, from Altamont to 'Exile and from club gigs to stadium extravaganzas. Featuring extensive historical footage, much of it widely unseen, with contemporary commentaries by Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Charlie Watts, Ronnie Wood and former Stones Bill Wyman and Mick Taylor

programme.desc: Love Monster, Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny and Bad Idea Puppy arrive at Elder Kitten's house with a cart full of decorating things. It's Makeover Day, and they want to make over Elder Kitten's living room while he gets a relaxing makeover himself at the Fluffytown spa. When they finish, Love Monster thinks it's very different from Elder Kitten's usual style. He starts to wonder whether Elder Kitten will be good surprised or bad surprised. Just then, Elder Kitten returns from his spa day. Bad Idea Puppy and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny show him his new living room and explain that they decorated with the best bright things they could think of. As Elder Kitten looks on a little unsure, Love Monster asks him whether he loves it. Elder Kitten is a little lost for words and, not wanting to hurt their feelings, he simply agrees with them that it's bright and very different. Then, there’s a healthy eating quiz based on the food groups that make up a balanced diet. Finally, the teams must take items from a giant conveyer belt and sort them so they can be reused and recycled. To make it even trickier, the players are attached to bungee cords! programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: Fred and Pete are treasure hunting on the sand when they discover a shiny sphere. What’s it for? Maybe Suzy and her robot Archie at the museum can help. Sure enough, Archie’s clue and Suzy’s endless list of Cornish contacts sees the hapless duo rock up in St Columb Major. There they meet Colin, who makes silver-covered balls for the game of hurling. But what exactly is hurling? Even these two can’t miss hurling expert Mayor Paul in his full regalia. Paul explains how hurling is a game played by Town and Country teams in St Columb Major, where the silver ball is thrown and ‘hurled’ between team members, but the pitch consists of the entire town and the goals are miles apart! Fred and Pete soon run out of puff trying to play on their own, but Suzy points them back to the playing fields where the mayor and some children are about to play a game. programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: When a strange, lumpy, green ball rolls to their feet, Fred and Pete are sure they've found treasure. But what is it? At the Museum of Cornish Treasures, Archie tells them that their treasure grew up in Cornwall under a big dome, and Suzy sends them to the Eden Project to find out more. Here, they meet Catherine who says their treasure is a type of fruit from a place far away. But how did the fruit get to Cornwall? Suzy buzzes on the Treasure Comm and suggests Fred and Pete take a trip on a zip wire and explore the tropical dome. They meet Catherine again who reveals their treasure is a screw pine fruit. This fruit is usually found in hot countries in Asia and Africa but is able to grow in Eden’s dome because it's so warm inside. Catherine takes Fred and Pete on a plant hunt around the tropical dome. Catherine explains how fruits produce seeds which then grow into new trees that produce fruits themselves

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Reau, Alfie, Charlie, Ollie, Otis, River and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Giovanna’s bag is a night light, and all the parents and babies have different objects and toys that could be used as part of a bedtime routine. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate bedtime objects and toys inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The baby lullaby Little One Time For Bed features, as does a story involving Baby Bear, and viewers at home show what they’ve been doing at bedtime too. The Baby Bear Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory lights and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome babies Lola, Sullivan, Pip, Theo, Oakley and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Nigel has got a fluffy pom pom inside his bag. All the parents and babies have different toys or objects that feel fluffy too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to hide a safe, baby-appropriate fluffy toy or object inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, to explore with their baby. Some viewers at home show what fluffy items they’ve been playing with too. The traditional nursery rhyme Mary Had a Little Lamb features, as does a story about Baby Bear exploring different textures. The Baby Bear Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of the second session of day two from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where the men's 100m takes centre-stage with semi-finals at 3.35 and the final at 6.10. The Americans dominated the sprint event last year on home territory in Eugene, with Fred Kerley narrowly defeating compatriots Marvin Bracy and Trayvon Bromell, but Great Britain's Zharnel Hughes will also hope to be in contention this time around after breaking Linford Christie's long-standing national record this year. The heptathlon concludes with the 800m at 5.00, and medals are also awarded in the women's long jump from 3.55, the men's hammer from 4.50 and the men's 10,000m at 5.25. Jeanette Kwakye presents, with analysis from Michael Johnson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani visits a family-run sheep farm in Somerset that has hosted a a music festival every summer for the past 18 years, and helps out with preparations. She assists in preparing a mutton curry in the farm cafe kitchen for hundreds of campers, and uses wool from the sheep to stuff sofas. She also dips into the archives to present some memorable features on rural music

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: At Brodie Castle in the north of Scotland, Fiona Bruce meets a Highland Games commentator who has brought along a collection of items including a weighty shot put, a heavy hammer and a brooch presented by Queen Victoria in 1848. Ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet uncovers a brush pot found at the bottom of the sea, while Matthew Haley takes a closer look at a book written by Bram Stoker discovered in a charity shop

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Harry is shipped back to Manchester due to concerns about his mental health, and is furious at the implication he is doomed to follow in his father's footsteps. As he returns home, Kasia prepares to leave for Europe on an important mission. Henriette returns home have smuggled David out of France, and Marga plots to flee for Berlin. Rajib encounters a German patrol and tries to negotiate a ceasefire

The Hammers and Blues drew 1-1 in last season's corresponding fixture, and both teams will be looking for improved league campaigns this time around. The Villans overcame Everton home and away in the previous campaign, with Emiliano Buendia scoring in both games. Plus, a round-up of Friday and Saturday's top-flight goals

MI5 officer Will Holloway must team up with disgraced intelligence chief Harry Pearce to track him down before an imminent terrorist attack on London. Spy thriller, starring Kit Harington and Peter Firth

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood joins everyday hard grafters who keep the country's essential infrastructure running, beginning in Belfast harbour, where ferries leave for the UK mainland. His mentor is operations manager Howard Hillis, who has worked at the harbour for the last 21 years. Dom is thrown in at the deep end, spending 24 hours at sea, learning the ropes alongside the captain and many of his crew, before transferring to the historic Harland & Wolff dockyards, where the Titanic was built, to assist with the essential maintenance of a ship in dry dock

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

Martel Maxwell is in Leeds to see a back-to-back, two-bedroom mid-terrace, while Dion Dublin is in Birmingham where a two-bed semi-detached house needs bringing up to date. programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Mark Draisey, a caricaturist who switched disciplines after 30 years to become a traditional portrait painter, creates the final image of the series, depicting hospital porter Holly. When her eight-year-old daughter Renae was diagnosed with a brain tumour, Holly was overwhelmed by the care and support her family received and wanted to give back to the service. After five years of remission, Renae has fully recovered and aspires to join the NHS as a midwife one day

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Further live coverage of day three from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, which includes the final of the women's 100m at 8.50. Great Britain's Dina Asher-Smith and Daryll Neita will hope to be involved, but the Jamaican athletes reigned supreme in this event last year, with Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce, Shericka Jackson and Elaine Thompson-Herah taking gold, silver and bronze respectively. Medals are also awarded in the men's discus from 7.30 and the men's 110m hurdles from 8.40

programme.title: Tommy Jessop Goes to Hollywood
programme.desc: Line of Duty actor Tommy Jessop has starred in high-profile TV programmes and short films, and now wants to be a leading man. However, the right roles are not being offered to him. Tommy wants to show that people like him with Down syndrome can play heroes and so, inspired by the advice of his agent, takes matters into his own hands. Enlisting the help of his brother, film-maker Will Jessop, Tommy sets off on an epic creative journey to develop and star in his own superhero movie, which he intends to pitch to Hollywood

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Steph McGovern hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Jamie MacDonald and mathematician Professor Hannah Fry joining Ian Hislop and Paul Merton. First shown in October 2022

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In London, a Met officer is attacked by a man with a four-foot-long broadsword and an officer in York uses all her strength and courage to rescue a colleague from an icy river

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A bio-archaeologist helps police investigate a body found in a lake and a virologist helps determine the guilt of a man accused of intentionally spreading HIV

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood finds out what it takes to fill the UK's freezers with peas, joining the harvest on a Yorkshire farm and helping at the factory where they are bagged and frozen

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits Sketty near Swansea to see a three-bed semi with original features and heads to Ilfracombe, North Devon to see a two-bedroom with a bad first impression. Tommy Walsh is in London on the Isle of dogs where a three bed flat has great development potential

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt are in Nottinghamshire to help two teams look for items of value at the Newark Antiques Fair. Presenter Charlie Ross gets the lowdown on the resurgence of brown furniture, before the whole team heads to Derby for some auction action

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers are matchmaking for Zuri the fennec fox who has been historically unlucky in love and take a big step forward in the antelope breeding programme. Hamza Yassin takes on legendary park keeper Ian Turner in a photography competition and tries to get some laughs out of the lions while Megan McCubbin helps with an experiment to provide fresh food all year round for the African colobus monkeys

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of Turner, one of Britain's most loved artists, Rick discovers how much the Cornish landscape influenced his work. At Newlyn Fish Market, he counts in the daily catch with the head auctioneer, who tells him how the market has adapted to modern times, while at Caerhays Castle, home to the nation's largest collection of magnolia plants, Rick discovers how this corner of Cornwall was once home to some of the great Victorian plant hunters

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah explores Arundel in West Sussex, in her quest for the ideal location as her buyers seek the right place to spend their £900,000 on. She hands over the keys to some surprising houses, but will her self-confessed 'instant buyers' decide to seal the deal on any of them?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Expert Pete Woods meets John who brings in a trumpet that was gifted to him by his grandfather Frank who played it in an army band during the Second World War. John is hoping Pete can repair the instrument so he can start teaching his own grandson to play, the same way his grandad taught him. Claire brings in a delicately painted wardrobe given to her great grandparents to celebrate their marriage. Wood restorer Will Kirk tries to save the broken cupboard which is completely missing a back board and internal shelves. The final visitor to the barn is Jane who brings in a rickety old ironing board for the attention of Dominic Chinea that reminds her of the time her and her husband couldn't afford a home and lived in a squat

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil gets serious with Alfie about his health and Suki worries that Eve isn't coping well after speaking to Caz. Anna tells her family about her plans to contact her mum and Bobby is shocked to learn Kathy is selling the chippy

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki and Stacey come together to help Eve but Theo's meddling doesn't help. Things go wrong for Patrick when Yolande's ex-lover Anton arrives and Phil continues to put pressure on Alfie. A familiar face returns to the square

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Further live coverage of day four from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are awarded in the women's 1500m at 8.30 and the men's 3,000m steeplechase at 8.42. Great Britain's Laura Muir will be looking to build on her 1500m bronze medal at last year's championships in Eugene, while reigning world and Olympic title holder Soufiane El Bakkali could again be the man to beat in the steeplechase

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Actors Amy Walsh and Michael Praed, rapper and philanthropist Apl.de.Ap, dancer Dianne Buswell and reality star Luca Bish compete in the final week of heats. Faced first with the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient to incorporate into a meal for judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace before preparing their Dinner Party Dishes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Walescast
programme.desc: BBC Wales politics editor Felicity Evans and political correspondent James Williams present interviews with MPs and analysis from experts about what is happening in the world of Welsh politics

programme.title: Boot Dreams: Now or Never
programme.desc: Roman Kemp presents a documentary following young footballers rejected by top clubs as they get a second chance through a unique camp at Manchester City's former training ground, under the watchful eye of former premier league player Gifton Noel-Williams. The first episode features a training match against Manchester International Football Academy

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium and Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium. Spurs and United shared the spoils in an entertaining 2-2 draw in last season's corresponding fixture, and the Citizens claimed a 2-0 win at home to the Magpies. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Sheffield United, Fulham v Brentford, Liverpool v Bournemouth and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Brighton & Hove Albion

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton discuss whether parents are accountable for the crimes of their children, and if some topics should be off-limits in comedy. Plus, tips on reducing single-use plastics in the home

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Spain v England (Kick-off 11.00am). All the action from the showpiece match, held at Stadium Australia in Sydney. Spain have reached the final for the first time after a dramatic 2-1 win over Sweden in the semi-finals, while England are also making their debut in this match after prevailing 3-1 in an end-to-end clash with Australia

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Restoration expert Jay Blades is at Walsall Recycling Centre in the West Midlands, where he's on the lookout for two unwanted items to save and sell on. Upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith takes on the challenge of transforming some retro tulip chairs, while Jay has a bureau to add some creativity to. The hope is that they can succeed in finding new homes for these upcycled items

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: City-dwelling families, couples and individuals set out to find their ideal rural retreats with the help of a property expert

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of the second session of day two from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where the men's 100m takes centre-stage with semi-finals at 3.35 and the final at 6.10. The Americans dominated the sprint event last year on home territory in Eugene, with Fred Kerley narrowly defeating compatriots Marvin Bracy and Trayvon Bromell, but Great Britain's Zharnel Hughes will also hope to be in contention this time around after breaking Linford Christie's long-standing national record this year. The heptathlon concludes with the 800m at 5.00, and medals are also awarded in the women's long jump from 3.55, the men's hammer from 4.50 and the men's 10,000m at 5.25. Jeanette Kwakye presents, with analysis from Michael Johnson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani visits a family-run sheep farm in Somerset that has hosted a a music festival every summer for the past 18 years, and helps out with preparations. She assists in preparing a mutton curry in the farm cafe kitchen for hundreds of campers, and uses wool from the sheep to stuff sofas. She also dips into the archives to present some memorable features on rural music

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: At Brodie Castle in the north of Scotland, Fiona Bruce meets a Highland Games commentator who has brought along a collection of items including a weighty shot put, a heavy hammer and a brooch presented by Queen Victoria in 1848. Ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet uncovers a brush pot found at the bottom of the sea, while Matthew Haley takes a closer look at a book written by Bram Stoker discovered in a charity shop

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Harry is shipped back to Manchester due to concerns about his mental health, and is furious at the implication he is doomed to follow in his father's footsteps. As he returns home, Kasia prepares to leave for Europe on an important mission. Henriette returns home have smuggled David out of France, and Marga plots to flee for Berlin. Rajib encounters a German patrol and tries to negotiate a ceasefire

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring West Ham United v Chelsea at London Stadium and Aston Villa v Everton at Villa Park. The Hammers and Blues drew 1-1 in last season's corresponding fixture, and both teams will be looking for improved league campaigns this time around. The Villans overcame Everton home and away in the previous campaign, with Emiliano Buendia scoring in both games. Plus, a round-up of Friday and Saturday's top-flight goals

programme.title: Fifa Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: BBC coverage of the sporting event

programme.title: Spooks: The Greater Good (2015)
programme.desc: A terrorist escapes custody during a prisoner handover when the convoy he is being transported in is attacked, leading to a CIA operative being killed and relations becoming frayed between British and American intelligence agencies. MI5 officer Will Holloway must team up with disgraced intelligence chief Harry Pearce to track him down before an imminent terrorist attack on London. Spy thriller, starring Kit Harington and Peter Firth

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A Surrey police officer receives life-changing injuries when his patrol car is involved in a terrifying high-speed crash. Two officers in Cheshunt risk their lives and run into a burning building to perform CPR on a man trapped inside. Officers in West Mercia are tackling dangerous driving using footage from the public

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: Police turn to a facial reconstruction expert to help identify a dismembered body, and a cell site expert uses his tracking skills to catch killers in Northern Ireland

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood joins everyday hard grafters who keep the country's essential infrastructure running, beginning in Belfast harbour, where ferries leave for the UK mainland. His mentor is operations manager Howard Hillis, who has worked at the harbour for the last 21 years. Dom is thrown in at the deep end, spending 24 hours at sea, learning the ropes alongside the captain and many of his crew, before transferring to the historic Harland & Wolff dockyards, where the Titanic was built, to assist with the essential maintenance of a ship in dry dock

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is in Chesterton, Staffordshire, to see a two bedroom bungalow bought by someone downsizing to their 'forever home'. Martel Maxwell is in Leeds to see a back-to-back, two-bedroom mid-terrace, while Dion Dublin is in Birmingham where a two-bed semi-detached house needs bringing up to date. Following an auction, the successful bidders' plans for their acquisitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Kingston upon Thames in Surrey, with experts Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. Eric also discovers the fascinating life of florist Constance Spry

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers must establish which wolf could be the new leader of the pack, and are worried that a North American tree porcupine is not eating properly

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef joins a team diving for razor clams, which he takes back to the kitchen to make a quick and tasty dish of grilled shangurro clams. In the Penlee Museum, Rick is shown some of the beautiful items made a century ago by fishermen using Cornish copper, and meets a metalworker who is bringing such wares back to the town

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Presenter Steve Brown helps a bachelor find an ideal property in Guildford, Surrey, on a budget of £420,000

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team performs a handbag repair for a 1960s typist, and fix up a toy tractor that belonged to a farmer who died in a tragic accident at work

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Gyles Brandreth on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Mark Draisey, a caricaturist who switched disciplines after 30 years to become a traditional portrait painter, creates the final image of the series, depicting hospital porter Holly. When her eight-year-old daughter Renae was diagnosed with a brain tumour, Holly was overwhelmed by the care and support her family received and wanted to give back to the service. After five years of remission, Renae has fully recovered and aspires to join the NHS as a midwife one day

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Further live coverage of day three from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, which includes the final of the women's 100m at 8.50. Great Britain's Dina Asher-Smith and Daryll Neita will hope to be involved, but the Jamaican athletes reigned supreme in this event last year, with Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce, Shericka Jackson and Elaine Thompson-Herah taking gold, silver and bronze respectively. Medals are also awarded in the men's discus from 7.30 and the men's 110m hurdles from 8.40

programme.title: Tommy Jessop Goes to Hollywood
programme.desc: Line of Duty actor Tommy Jessop has starred in high-profile TV programmes and short films, and now wants to be a leading man. However, the right roles are not being offered to him. Tommy wants to show that people like him with Down syndrome can play heroes and so, inspired by the advice of his agent, takes matters into his own hands. Enlisting the help of his brother, film-maker Will Jessop, Tommy sets off on an epic creative journey to develop and star in his own superhero movie, which he intends to pitch to Hollywood
