Dom is thrown in at the deep end, spending 24 hours at sea, learning the ropes alongside the captain and many of his crew, before transferring to the historic Harland & Wolff dockyards, where the Titanic was built, to assist with the essential maintenance of a ship in dry dock

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is in Chesterton, Staffordshire, to see a two bedroom bungalow bought by someone downsizing to their 'forever home'. Martel Maxwell is in Leeds to see a back-to-back, two-bedroom mid-terrace, while Dion Dublin is in Birmingham where a two-bed semi-detached house needs bringing up to date. Following an auction, the successful bidders' plans for their acquisitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Kingston upon Thames in Surrey, with experts Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. Eric also discovers the fascinating life of florist Constance Spry

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers must establish which wolf could be the new leader of the pack, and are worried that a North American tree porcupine is not eating properly

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef joins a team diving for razor clams, which he takes back to the kitchen to make a quick and tasty dish of grilled shangurro clams. In the Penlee Museum, Rick is shown some of the beautiful items made a century ago by fishermen using Cornish copper, and meets a metalworker who is bringing such wares back to the town

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Presenter Steve Brown helps a bachelor find an ideal property in Guildford, Surrey, on a budget of £420,000

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team performs a handbag repair for a 1960s typist, and fix up a toy tractor that belonged to a farmer who died in a tragic accident at work

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Gyles Brandreth on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Mark Draisey, a caricaturist who switched disciplines after 30 years to become a traditional portrait painter, creates the final image of the series, depicting hospital porter Holly. When her eight-year-old daughter Renae was diagnosed with a brain tumour, Holly was overwhelmed by the care and support her family received and wanted to give back to the service. After five years of remission, Renae has fully recovered and aspires to join the NHS as a midwife one day

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Further live coverage of day three from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, which includes the final of the women's 100m at 8.50. Great Britain's Dina Asher-Smith and Daryll Neita will hope to be involved, but the Jamaican athletes reigned supreme in this event last year, with Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce, Shericka Jackson and Elaine Thompson-Herah taking gold, silver and bronze respectively. Medals are also awarded in the men's discus from 7.30 and the men's 110m hurdles from 8.40

programme.title: Tommy Jessop Goes to Hollywood
programme.desc: Line of Duty actor Tommy Jessop has starred in high-profile TV programmes and short films, and now wants to be a leading man. However, the right roles are not being offered to him. Tommy wants to show that people like him with Down syndrome can play heroes and so, inspired by the advice of his agent, takes matters into his own hands. Enlisting the help of his brother, film-maker Will Jessop, Tommy sets off on an epic creative journey to develop and star in his own superhero movie, which he intends to pitch to Hollywood

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Golf: World Invitational
programme.desc: The Isps Handa World Invitational Presented By Aviv Clinics. Stephen Watson presents action from the DP World Tour event from Galgorm and Castlerock Golf Club in Co Antrim. The event featured some of the world's leading male and female players, who competed for equal prize money

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Steph McGovern hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Jamie MacDonald and mathematician Professor Hannah Fry joining Ian Hislop and Paul Merton. First shown in October 2022

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In London, a Met officer is attacked by a man with a four-foot-long broadsword and an officer in York uses all her strength and courage to rescue a colleague from an icy river

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A bio-archaeologist helps police investigate a body found in a lake and a virologist helps determine the guilt of a man accused of intentionally spreading HIV

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood finds out what it takes to fill the UK's freezers with peas, joining the harvest on a Yorkshire farm and helping at the factory where they are bagged and frozen

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits Sketty near Swansea to see a three-bed semi with original features and heads to Ilfracombe, North Devon to see a two-bedroom with a bad first impression. Tommy Walsh is in London on the Isle of dogs where a three bed flat has great development potential

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt are in Nottinghamshire to help two teams look for items of value at the Newark Antiques Fair. Presenter Charlie Ross gets the lowdown on the resurgence of brown furniture, before the whole team heads to Derby for some auction action

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers are matchmaking for Zuri the fennec fox who has been historically unlucky in love and take a big step forward in the antelope breeding programme. Hamza Yassin takes on legendary park keeper Ian Turner in a photography competition and tries to get some laughs out of the lions while Megan McCubbin helps with an experiment to provide fresh food all year round for the African colobus monkeys

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of Turner, one of Britain's most loved artists, Rick discovers how much the Cornish landscape influenced his work. At Newlyn Fish Market, he counts in the daily catch with the head auctioneer, who tells him how the market has adapted to modern times, while at Caerhays Castle, home to the nation's largest collection of magnolia plants, Rick discovers how this corner of Cornwall was once home to some of the great Victorian plant hunters

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah explores Arundel in West Sussex, in her quest for the ideal location as her buyers seek the right place to spend their £900,000 on. She hands over the keys to some surprising houses, but will her self-confessed 'instant buyers' decide to seal the deal on any of them?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Expert Pete Woods meets John who brings in a trumpet that was gifted to him by his grandfather Frank who played it in an army band during the Second World War. John is hoping Pete can repair the instrument so he can start teaching his own grandson to play, the same way his grandad taught him. Claire brings in a delicately painted wardrobe given to her great grandparents to celebrate their marriage. Wood restorer Will Kirk tries to save the broken cupboard which is completely missing a back board and internal shelves. The final visitor to the barn is Jane who brings in a rickety old ironing board for the attention of Dominic Chinea that reminds her of the time her and her husband couldn't afford a home and lived in a squat

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil gets serious with Alfie about his health and Suki worries that Eve isn't coping well after speaking to Caz. Anna tells her family about her plans to contact her mum and Bobby is shocked to learn Kathy is selling the chippy

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki and Stacey come together to help Eve but Theo's meddling doesn't help. Things go wrong for Patrick when Yolande's ex-lover Anton arrives and Phil continues to put pressure on Alfie. A familiar face returns to the square

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Further live coverage of day four from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are awarded in the women's 1500m at 8.30 and the men's 3,000m steeplechase at 8.42. Great Britain's Laura Muir will be looking to build on her 1500m bronze medal at last year's championships in Eugene, while reigning world and Olympic title holder Soufiane El Bakkali could again be the man to beat in the steeplechase

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Actors Amy Walsh and Michael Praed, rapper and philanthropist Apl.de.Ap, dancer Dianne Buswell and reality star Luca Bish compete in the final week of heats. Faced first with the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient to incorporate into a meal for judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace before preparing their Dinner Party Dishes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Boot Dreams: Now or Never
programme.desc: Roman Kemp presents a documentary following young footballers rejected by top clubs as they get a second chance through a unique camp at Manchester City's former training ground, under the watchful eye of former premier league player Gifton Noel-Williams. The first episode features a training match against Manchester International Football Academy

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Paralympic legend Hannah Cockroft, former Premier League striker Clinton Morrison, Great Britain sprinter Desiree Henry and sports broadcaster Nat Coombs join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: It's the finale of The Travel Show special 'How Does a Blind Girl Go on Safari?'. Visually impaired Lucy Edwards makes her way to the Maasai Mara for 'The Great Migration', said to be one of nature's most spectacular events. In this episode, Lucy comes across the last line of defence against rhino poaching, hikes down to the foot of Thomson's Falls, and spends the day at a Maasai Village. But will she get the chance to experience one of the elusive river crossings where wildebeest risk their lives passing lions and crocodiles? Part 2 of 2.

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: It's the finale of The Travel Show special 'How Does a Blind Girl Go on Safari?'. Visually impaired Lucy Edwards makes her way to the Maasai Mara for 'The Great Migration', said to be one of nature's most spectacular events. In this episode, Lucy comes across the last line of defence against rhino poaching, hikes down to the foot of Thomson's Falls, and spends the day at a Maasai Village. But will she get the chance to experience one of the elusive river crossings where wildebeest risk their lives passing lions and crocodiles? Part 2 of 2.

programme.title: Of Diabolical Purpose - Sgeulachd Monsieur Chantrelle
programme.desc: Using dramatic reconstructions and expert opinion, John Morrison revisits the story of Eugene Chantrelle, a French teacher hanged for murdering his wife in Edinburgh in 1878. A gifted linguist with medical knowledge, he frequently threatened to poison his wife - and was accused of so doing upon her death. Chantrelle pleaded his innocence up to the moment he was hanged and the evidence against him was circumstancial - and his great-grandson speaks of the lasting damage caused to the family

programme.title: Seirm
programme.desc: A selection of tracks from the world of trad and folk music, performed by Shooglenifty and Ross Ainslie, recorded at the Arches in 2021

programme.title: Eadar na Dha: 1918-1935/Clash of Futures: 1918-1935
programme.desc: The impact of mass unemployment in the early 1930s, as Communists and National Socialists fight bloody street battles and Adolf Hitler is named Chancellor of the Reich

programme.title: Dhan Uisge
programme.desc: Calum Maclean swims in the River Etive, the water Calum claims is the most fun for a swimmer. Running between Glencoe to the sea, the river is full of amazing pools

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: AH-AH thinks that there is talent to be found in Allt na Coille when there is a circus event taking place, but doesn't know what talents there actually are

programme.desc: Linda tasks Meaban and Moo with finding purple items. Their hut is full of junk so Meaban and Moo just need to have a good rummage

programme.desc: Debbie Mackay reads A' Chiad Latha aig Cailleach-oidhche Bheag by Debi Gliori, illustrated by Alison Brown and translated into Gaelic by Donald John MacLeod

programme.desc: When Tintin realises that the crystal balls inflict suffering on members of the expedition, he meets with Professor Tarragon, who has Rascar Capac. With Capac evaporating, the curse of the Inca is now unleashed

programme.title: An Solas Buan (Lighthouses of Scotland)
programme.desc: The work of lighthouse architects David and Charles Stevenson, whose pragmatic and modern designs feature on a number of small unmanned lights. Examples of their work include designs at Rattray Head, Stroma, Bass Rock and the Brough of Birsay

programme.title: SpeakGaelic

programme.title: Bannan (The Ties That Bind)

Tormod and Raonaid regret the night before, and Donna and Finlay return from holiday to find their money problems have only just begun

programme.title: Baby Killer? Sgeulachd Jessie King
programme.desc: The story of Jessie King, who at the age of 27 was on trial at the High Court in Edinburgh after she was accused of killing three babies. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd has an unexpected windfall of crumbs and sets out to buy happiness, cleaning the newsstand out of comics, dining at the Pancake, and hiring his friends to carry his lovely crumbs around - however, he soon learns that crumbs can't buy true happiness.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. With Gena and Malcolm out for the evening, Lloyd is left in charge of PB and 224 maggots - how hard can maggotsitting be? Keen to get his duties over as quickly as possible, Lloyd skimps on the bedtime story, prompting a mass exodus of maggots!

programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. It is the hottest day of the year and Gran's naughty knitting crew have dressed the whole town in their woolly wares - when their finest work, a giant sock puppet, comes to life, Dave must stop it from eating them all.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. His genius still unappreciated, Fizz decides to go on a spiritual retreat in a forest clearing, but Mr Magoo, who believes that he's on an orangutan reserve, mistakes the hamster for a feral child.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Spain v England (Kick-off 11.00am). Coverage of the showpiece match, held at Stadium Australia in Sydney, as btoh teams look to lift the trophy for the first time. Spain came second behind Japan in their group, but went on to defeat Switzerland, the Netherlands and Sweden to reach this stage. England topped a group ahead of Denmark, China and Haiti and then eliminated Nigeria, Colombia and Australia. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Karen Carney and Eni Aluko

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Ian Wright hosts as three more teams of two try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. Can married couple Manny and Atim win enough to secure a deposit on their first house together, will couple Emma and Rachael scoop enough to take a break from work and travel the world, and can friends Marc and Andy win big and take away tens of thousands of pounds?

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. A birthday cake sets a house on fire, a toddler puts an iPad in a washing machine and a cow breaks into a home to use the swimming pool

programme.title: Die Another Day (2002)
programme.desc: James Bond is suspended from duty after being taken hostage in North Korea, but goes against orders to track down those who betrayed him. During the pursuit of the terrorist he was investigating before his capture, he discovers a connection with a British billionaire who has constructed a devastating orbital weapon. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Halle Berry, Toby Stephens, Judi Dench and John Cleese

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard asks the questions as Phil Tufnell, Colin Jackson and Lisa Riley answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: Downton Abbey (2019)
programme.desc: In 1927, Buckingham Palace informs Robert and Cora Crawley, the Earl and Countess of Grantham, that George V and Queen Mary will visit Downton Abbey during a royal tour through Yorkshire. The occasion soon unleashes scandal, romance and intrigue - leaving the future of Downton hanging in the balance. Director Michael Engler's drama based on the TV series, starring Hugh Bonneville, Michelle Dockery and Maggie Smith

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two men, both of them born in Ireland to unmarried mothers at a time when having children outside of marriage was seen as sinful and the Catholic Church went to great lengths to cover it up. When Arthur Fitzharris's adoptive parents died he decided to find out about his birth family, and was dismayed to discover that his birth certificate falsely recorded early foster parents as though they were his biological parents. Bernard McGrath discovered his adoptive parents were falsely named as his biological parents on his birth certificate and no other records seemed available to him

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Acclaimed actor and Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville, and one of the UK's successful comedians John Bishop, make for an unlikely friendship. However, a chance meeting in a Covid vaccine centre has made them mates and now they're about to cement that friendship on a road trip to discover their family history - but what they both don't know is that they have a deeper connection to each other through their ancestors

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Great British Escape
programme.desc: In a new six-part series, Paul O'Grady shares the beautiful sights, stories and secrets of his beloved adopted home county, Kent. This time, Paul hops on the Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch Railway, a beautiful miniature steam train that runs along the picturesque Kent coastline. Arriving in Dungeness, Paul heads to the RSPB nature reserve, before travelling to Dungeness beach, the largest expanse of shingle anywhere in Europe. Finally, Paul heads inland to the heart of the Romney Marshes, where he meets another unexpected local resident - a unlikely herd of alpacas

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team turn a suburban plot in Hull into a wildlife retreat for a nature-loving teenager and his family. programme.desc: In a new six-part series, Paul O'Grady shares the beautiful sights, stories and secrets of his beloved adopted home county, Kent. This time, Paul hops on the Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch Railway, a beautiful miniature steam train that runs along the picturesque Kent coastline. Arriving in Dungeness, Paul heads to the RSPB nature reserve, before travelling to Dungeness beach, the largest expanse of shingle anywhere in Europe. Finally, Paul heads inland to the heart of the Romney Marshes, where he meets another unexpected local resident - a unlikely herd of alpacas

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme

programme.desc: A veteran beat cop and a teenage girl fall to their deaths from a tower block in south-east London. Left alive on the roof are a five-year-old boy and rookie police officer Lizzie Adama, who disappears within hours. Detective Sergeant Sarah Collins is charged with leading the investigation, trying to track down Lizzie before she comes to serious harm and uncovering the truth behind what happened. Crime thriller based on Kate London's novel Post Mortem, starring Gemma Whelan

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Peggy and Ruth try to patch up a local pig farmer's marriage, while Stephen receives his exam results and faces the prospect of leaving town for good. The Skelthwaite Scorpions take on sworn enemies the Hoxton Giants, and for Vic it promises to be the match of a lifetime. Pam Ferris, Tony Haygarth and Sarah Lancashire star

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Peggy argues with Ruth after Vic comes a cropper in Simon's factory, and later comforts Mary Cooper as she tries to come to terms with the death of her husband. Meanwhile, Stephen returns home. Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire star

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A nurse with her head full of new ideas joins the ranks, ruffling Peggy and Ruth's feathers, while Stephen's barely got his feet back under his mum's table before he's drawn into a steamy love triangle

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina is shocked to discover a severed hand in a dustbin and the subsequent police investigation unearths evidence which suggests someone on Lord Ashfordly's estate may be responsible. Meanwhile, Peggy invests in a freezer for her latest business venture, but soon finds her new purchase at the centre of the murder case. Last in series, starring Tricia Penrose, Gwen Taylor and Jonathan Kerrigan

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack is asked to investigate the theft of a car belonging to a friend of Mullett, but misjudges the grizzled Superintendent's capacity for tact and diplomacy and it is not long before he is taken off the case. Things take a shocking turn when the car finally turns up - with the body of a drug dealer in the boot. Detective drama, starring David Jason, with Melanie Thaw and Bruce Alexander

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Alf poses as a criminal as part of an undercover operation, but his covert actions only reveal startling information about Miller's ethical beliefs. David eyes up Peggy's room when she applies to be Lord Ashfordly's housekeeper - but both are left disappointed when the interview is a complete failure. Rural drama, starring William Simons, John Duttine, David Stockwell and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gang of youths push Peggy down a hole while she's poaching. Lord Ashfordly alerts Miller, who gives chase - but lands himself in trouble when he knocks down an elderly pedestrian. However, the incident gives Peggy a new money-making idea - she'll sue for the 'injury' she sustained in the fall. Meanwhile, Gina is attracted to her handsome college tutor. Tim Brooke-Taylor and Murray Head guest star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy landowner Gregory Lancaster's body goes missing on the night of his death, a sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton. As DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new forensic pathologist Kam Karimore investigate the mysterious crime, they find themselves drawn into a macabre world of body-snatching during their quest to identify the perpetrator. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk, Helen Baxendale and Navin Chowdhry

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: While working with the drug squad, Ronnie and Joe find a skeleton that has been hidden inside the boot of a car in the River Thames. It turns out to be the remains of Taylor Kane, an undercover policeman who went missing in the 1980s - around the time of the Brixton riots. Through clever detection, unsettling evidence is unearthed and the team knows it must raise issues the police would rather forget. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, and featuring one of the last performances by Roger Lloyd-Pack, who died in January

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Two years ago, George meets Armin and Amifa, whose dark and dingy 1920s house in Bellingham, south east London, was not just ugly - the DIY extension added by former owners had been condemned and the makeshift kitchen was an accident waiting to happen. Architect Carl Turner did what he could with the £80,000 budget, but in the end the upstairs was left unfinished. George now returns to see how Armin and Amifa have tackled the top floor

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Lancing, West Sussex, where pharmacist Gloria and physiotherapist Tom are battling over whether to stay put or move on from their Victorian semi by the sea. With three young children, only three bedrooms and a tricky layout, Gloria is desperate to sell up and move somewhere bigger that offers space for her mum to stay over too. But husband Tom loves the garden as well as the seaside location and is sure Kirstie can work a bit of magic to give them a forever family home

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: Air Fryers: Are They Worth It?
programme.desc: Denise van Outen presents this a assessment of the device that has recently captured consumer interest, particularly since the hike in the price of energy. Alongside an army of home testers, Denise reveals the secrets behind the biggest kitchen revolution since the microwave, as explores the science and technology, tries out recipes and conducts taste tests to assess whether the reality matches the promises

programme.title: Levison Wood: Walking With
programme.desc: The explorer visits one of Earth's most remote and physically challenging environments in search of one of the world's most elusive populations of polar bears. Entering their world as the locals do, Levison learns more about the unique lives of these apex predators, their environment and how they're surviving against worsening odds caused by the increasing threat of human activity and climate change

programme.title: Grand Designs

But after the anchoring steel has been drilled into the ground, he runs into the double trouble - Covid-19 and a collapse in the Spanish property market. Will he ever finish this complicated - and expensive - construction?

programme.title: Alone

The incident occurred during a period of great unrest in Italy, as Moro, then president of the ruling party Christian Democrat party, hoped to form a coalition with the support of the Communist Party. He faces strong opposition from many directions, including within his own party and from the Vatican as well as violent discontent in the streets. In Italian, English and Latin

programme.desc: Bini currently supplies the service station freezer with nine of her delicious ready-made curries, all made using locally sourced ingredients, but she's keen to add to her range. She's confident that buyer Alex is going to love her chicken Jammu curry but takes a risk, hoping to impress him with a goat version wildcard - a meat she has never cooked with before

programme.title: Top Guns: Inside the RAF
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes - and in the cockpit - with the personnel at RAF Lossiemouth, as global tensions, including with Russia, impact on missions both at home and abroad. In the first episode, RAF pilot Jake Desmond is sent to NATO's frontline to face off against three Russian jets, and rookie pilot Harry Brooks tries to earn his wings and qualify for live operations

programme.title: The Price of Truth
programme.desc: Documentary following Dmitry Muratov, the editor of Russia's only independent newspaper as he struggles to maintain freedom of the press in the face of violent reprisals, including the murder of journalists and an acid attack that left his eyesight permanently damaged. The programme focuses on the period following the invasion of Ukraine, when Muratov remained determined to continue reporting on events in his homeland, despite the personal cost

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary following life inside an A&E department returns for its first series outside London - at the Queen's Medical Centre, Nottingham. Sister Lou tells her story of working at the hospital for more than 30 years and how her life completely changed in her 50s. Forty-five-year-old Kirsty has been rushed into QMC after an accident at a fun run. The team members carry out extensive tests on 93-year-old John, who is suffering from shortness of breath, and in the children's emergency unit, seven-year-old Hunter is being assessed after falling from a tree

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In this revisit episode, chef Gordon Ramsay goes back to Mojito, the Junction (formerly known as Flamangos) and Bazzini to check in with the owners he helped in the past and find out whether his advice has been put to good use. Will he be pleased with their progress?

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from in and around Stoke-on-Trent compete to host the best dinner party and walk away with the cash prize of £1,000. Exhibitionist Phil and long-suffering wife Sue begin the week with a meal showcasing his credentials as a master of the barbecue, while day two sees Becci and boyfriend Ashley's first dinner party, and the young couple aim high with a brave menu featuring a chocolate and avocado dessert and a curious stuffed chicken. Finally, husbands Gary and Simon attempt to out-do them all with a spot of fine dining, featuring the third prawn starter of the week

programme.title: Gagarine (2020)
programme.desc: A teenager who dreams of becoming an astronaut must first battle to save his housing project home from demolition. Reasoning that the authorities won't be able to knock it down if he works hard to fix it up, he enlists his friends to undertake improvements. But when his plan fails, more unusual methods are required. Drama, starring Alseni Bathily and Lyna Khoudri. In French, Romany and Russian

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Nine-year-old Kiya is given the best job ever - choosing a new furry friend out of a litter of three tiny cockapoos. Meanwhile, Wingnut the chihuahua has to prove to 16-year-old Jacob that chihuahuas are indeed cool and overexcited Yorkie Bam Bam needs to chill out if he is going to go home with Londoner Hannah

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a memorable restoration project in the remote Creuse region of central France. Back in 2003, when Denise Daniel and Doug Ibbs gave up everything in the UK to start a new life abroad, they couldn't have known what was ahead of them. Falling in love with a dilapidated manor house with just four crumbling walls and half a roof, they embarked on a mission to transform it - working day and night, doing everything themselves, year after year - until slowly but surely they created a magnificent edifice out of the ruins they bought off the internet. On the 70th anniversary of the destruction of the original 19th-century building by the German army, the house finally took its finished form

programme.title: Beat the Chef

programme.desc: Dan Walker and Helen Skelton explore Britain's first long-distance trail, the Pennine Way, travelling from Dan's home in Sheffield up to Helen's home in Cumbria. The pair begin their adventure in the Peak District, and from the stunning Bamford Edge, Dan and Helen survey The Pennine Way, stretching all the way to Scotland. Later, the duo cycle along the stunning, serpentine Snake Pass, before becoming the first members of the public to canoe along Standedge, Britain's longest, deepest, and highest canal tunnel

programme.title: Henry VIII: Rise of a Tyrant
programme.desc: Three-part drama-documentary series revealing the truth about England's most infamous King, King Henry VIII. The second episode takes viewers on a journey through the turbulent marriages, affairs and tyrannical politics of King Henry VIII's reign, and explores how Henry's obsession with marrying Anne Boleyn resulted in a cataclysmic and hugely unpopular split with the Roman Catholic Church. The programme also examines Henry's relationship with his new chief advisor and enforcer, Thomas Cromwell, who would come to bear the brunt of the King's increasing unhinged behaviour in the years to come. Narrated by Jason Isaacs

programme.desc: Aviation enthusiasts Top Landing Gear, who took their name from the podcast they started two years ago, take on the experts. Jeremy Vine hosts

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: A team made up of colleagues from the Spinal Injuries Association take part in the quiz, taking on the most formidable quiz team in Britain. Presented by Jeremy Vine

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Graeme meets a family struggling to adjust after adding a third dog to their household, and they hope that the expert trainer can help restore some harmony in their home. Elsewhere in Scotland, Graeme meets Elaine and her Beagle Lily, who interrupts every conversation Elaine tries to have when friends and family come over, and Lily's behaviour is driving them away

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Shona and the team attempt to deliver a cow called Tinkerbell's calf, and Julian comes to the aid of Shetland sheepdog Honey as she gives birth to her puppies. Elsewhere, Peter has to perform a tricky procedure on an alpaca, and Matt meets two iguanas brought in from Cannon Hall Farm with nasty looking skin conditions

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Dan & Helen's Pennine Adventure
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Helen Skelton begin the next leg of their journey atop Stoodley Pike Monument, a Northern landmark with stunning views across the region, before making their way to Hebden Bridge where they meet a talented ten-year-old planning to keep the craft of clog-making alive by continuing his grandparents' business. The pair then make their way to Saltaire, the village built by the Victorian industrialist Titus Salt for his workers, before their final stop at the the Cow and Calf Rocks on Ilkley Moor

programme.title: Crocodile Tears: The Murder of Caroline Crouch
programme.desc: The story of Caroline Crouch, a British woman in Greece who was found dead on her bed beside her alive 11-month-old baby girl. Caroline had been killed in the early hours of the morning at her home in a wealthy suburb of Athens, suffocated as she slept. Her husband told the police she was killed by a gang of foreign burglars who broke into their home and tied them both up. However, what appeared to be an idyllic life between Caroline and her husband was revealed to be far darker as she feared him and had been looking for somewhere else to live days before her murder

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: How light source technology and fibre analysis led to the conviction of murderer Stephen Marshall, who dismembered his victim and scattered the body parts across Hertfordshire

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The pubs finally reopen after nearly four months of lockdown and as a result the police prepare for a spike in drink-drive incidents on Derbyshire's roads. Paul investigates a report of a crash involving a car that has gone straight over a roundabout and then been abandoned, while Scott is called to a report of an alleged hit-and-run - which transpires to be the result of a fight between a pub-goers that spiralled out of control and into the path of oncoming motorists

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: My Cornwall with Fern Britton
programme.desc: The last leg of the presenter's road trip takes her to an industrious corner of Cornwall, the ancient Hundreds of Kerrier and Penwith. Fern discovers one of the best preserved ancient farming villages in the South West, which are among the oldest structures on the planet. Later, she visits the Lizard Peninsula, an area of outstanding natural beauty that as well as its unique landscape boasts a number of gems, including Cornish sea salt, Hevva Cake and Huer Huts. Finally, she meets some of the team from the RNLI at Lizard Point, the southernmost tip of mainland Britain

programme.title: Get Your Tatts Out: Kavos Ink
programme.desc: Leah from Wales orders a love heart tattoo, while best mates Callum and Steve decide to get each other's nicknames inked. Sarah and Devikah get matching yin and yang tattoos

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski examines pre-Reformation approaches to moral instruction, contrasting the humorous stone gargoyles of St Andrew's Church in Heckington, Lincolnshire, with the stark and sombre stained-glass windows found at St Mary's in the Gloucestershire town of Fairford

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: Monkey visits Lincolnshire, where he learns all about wind and how to fly his kite

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Chickaletta gets stuck on a runaway drone and mysterious butterflies cause chaos. Animated action adventure about a team of search-andrescue puppies

programme.title: Charlotte's Web (2006)
programme.desc: Youngster Fern tries to persuade her father to keep the runt of a litter when a sow gives birth to piglets on the family farm. While the little pig still looks destined for the chop, clever spider Charlotte hatches a plan to use her web-spinning talents to save him. Family drama, starring Dakota Fanning and featuring the voices of Julia Roberts, Dominic Scott Kay, Steve Buscemi and John Cleese

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Lightning Thief (2010)
programme.desc: A teenager is shocked to discover he is the son of Greek god Poseidon and has been accused of stealing Zeus's lightning bolt. The youngster is given 14 days to find the culprit and return the missing item before the furious deity instigates an apocalyptic war. Fantasy adventure, starring Logan Lerman, Pierce Brosnan, Brandon T Jackson, Alexandra Daddario, Jake Abel, Sean Bean and Steve Coogan

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa (2008)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals discover a plane and, following a swift repair job by the penguins, manage to escape the desolate shores of Madagascar. However, they crash-land on the plains of Africa and find themselves face-to-face with their wild counterparts for the first time. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Men in Black II (2002)
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: Steel Magnolias (1989)
programme.desc: The close friendship of six women from different generations, living in a backwoods town in America's Deep South, sustains them through life's joys and disappointments. Drama based on the play by Robert Harling, starring Sally Field, Julia Roberts, Dolly Parton, Shirley MacLaine, Olympia Dukakis, Daryl Hannah and Sam Shepard

programme.title: Life (2017)
programme.desc: A team of scientists on the International Space Station fight for survival when an intelligent alien life form is brought on board. The creature, nicknamed Calvin, proves it will do anything to stay alive, and the crew risk everything to ensure it does not make its way to Earth. Sci-fi thriller, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Rebecca Ferguson, Ryan Reynolds and Ariyon Bakare

programme.title: 47 Metres Down (2017)
programme.desc: Two sisters vacationing in Mexico are trapped in a shark cage at the bottom of the ocean. With less than an hour of oxygen left and great white sharks circling nearby, they must fight to survive. Horror, starring Mandy Moore, Claire Holt and Matthew Modine

programme.title: The Beast (2019)
programme.desc: Two Seoul police detectives are both in the running for the post of homicide department chief. However, they have to put aside their differences to solve the brutal murder of a schoolgirl. Director Jung-Ho Lee's drama, starring Sung-min Lee, Jae-myung Yoo and Daniel Choi. In Korean

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
programme.desc: Spooky couple Gomez and Morticia hire a nanny to look after their new baby son - and stop him suffering an early death at the hands of his jealous elder siblings. Romance soon blossoms between the new childminder and Uncle Fester, but he does not realise she is planning to kill him once she has got hold of the family fortune. Comedy sequel, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci and Joan Cusack

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada (2006)
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: Johnny English Strikes Again (2018)
programme.desc: A sinister cyber attack reveals the identity of all active undercover agents in Britain. Hapless secret agent Johnny English is sent on a mission to the South of France to protect Queen and country, and find the mastermind hacker responsible. Third movie in the comedy series, starring Rowan Atkinson, Ben Miller and Olga Kurylenko

programme.title: Gods of Egypt (2016)
programme.desc: An ancient Egyptian god is driven into exile when his evil brother murders their father and seizes his throne. He enlists the aid of a human thief in restoring justice, and in return offers to help the mortal to bring his murdered lover back to life. Fantasy adventure, starring Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Brenton Thwaites, Gerard Butler and Chadwick Boseman

programme.title: The Greatest Showman (2017)
programme.desc: After losing his job as a shipping clerk, PT Barnum creates and develops his circus in New York in the mid-1800s with the help of playwright Phillip Carlyle and an adopted family of entertainers shunned by society. Musical drama, starring Hugh Jackman, Zac Efron, Michelle Williams, Rebecca Ferguson and Zendaya

programme.title: The Festival (2018)
programme.desc: When Nick's girlfriend dumps him at graduation, he has a colossal meltdown in front of the entire university. He's convinced his life is over, but his best mate Shane has the perfect solution - three days at a music festival. With the help of 'festival aficionado' and certified oddball Amy, Shane tries to get Nick to embrace the music, the mayhem and the mud. Comedy, starring Joe Thomas, Hannah Tointon, Hammed Animashaun and Jemaine Clement

programme.title: Mulholland Drive (2001)
programme.desc: An actress arrives home to find a mysterious woman in her room who is suffering from amnesia. She sets out with the stranger to discover how she got there - but the trail quickly leads to intrigue, blackmail and murder. David Lynch's drama, starring Naomi Watts, Justin Theroux, Laura Harring and Robert Forster

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility (1995)
programme.desc: An impoverished family is taken in by a relative - and while sensible elder daughter Elinor's love for the sensitive Edward Ferrars meets with disapproval from his family, her more passionate younger sister Marianne engages in a disastrous romance with an infamous womaniser. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, directed by Ang Lee, and starring Emma Thompson (who also wrote the screenplay), Kate Winslet, Alan Rickman and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Jumanji (1995)
programme.desc: A man who has been trapped inside a mysterious jungle board game for 26 years is eventually freed when two children start to play it. Unfortunately, he arrives with a rampaging horde of animals on his heels, leaving only one solution - to finish the game he started all those years ago. Fantasy adventure, starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst and Bonnie Hunt

programme.title: Oliver! (1968)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: Junior (1994)
programme.desc: A fertility expert pioneers a treatment enabling men to become pregnant and carry babies to full term. When the authorities cancel funding for the research, he decides to test it on himself, but gives little thought to how difficult it will be to keep it a secret. The situation is further complicated when he starts to fall for the woman whose child he is carrying. Comedy, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Emma Thompson and Frank Langella

programme.title: Con Air (1997)
programme.desc: Honourably discharged Army Ranger sergeant Cameron Poe hitches a ride home on a maximum-security flight conveying some of America's deadliest criminals. When they hijack the plane in mid-flight, led by criminal mastermind Cyrus the Virus, Poe is forced to intervene. Meanwhile, US marshal Vince Larkin has an ongoing battle on the ground to prevent the plane from being blown to pieces. Director Simon West's blockbusting action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Cusack, John Malkovich, Steve Buscemi, Ving Rhames and Colm Meaney

programme.title: Coming to America (1988)
programme.desc: A bored African prince defies his father's plans for an arranged marriage and escapes to the USA to find a bride on his own terms. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Arsenio Hall in several roles, with James Earl Jones, Allison Dean, Eriq La Salle and Madge Sinclair

programme.title: Brick Lane (2007)
programme.desc: A Bangladeshi woman reluctantly leaves her native country for an arranged marriage in England. Years spent living in a drab east-London tower block take their toll, while her husband is consumed by his thwarted ambitions. However, an encounter with a cocky younger man changes her outlook on life. Drama, based on Monica Ali's novel, starring Tannishtha Chatterjee and Satish Kaushik

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: John Paul issues a threat that James can't ignore, Dilly opens up to Ethan about her past, Leela tries her best to help Donna-Marie and there is a grand relaunch at the Dog

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay's next stop is Philadelphia, where family run restaurant Chiarella's is struggling to survive in an area full of thriving Italian eateries. Tommy and Dina Defino's marriage is on the verge of collapse and his sense of personal failure only adds to the troubles of their crisis-ridden business

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire finally gets Phil to agree to sell their old car, Mitchell decides to build a large princess castle for Lily, and Manny invites a girl over for a study date - which makes Gloria uncomfortable. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. Starring Julie Bowen and Ty Burrell

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The young genius challenges a Nasa scientist about the space programme, and when he is dissatisfied with the answer, he begins to work on a series of equations to prove his point. Ian Armitage stars

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The Cooper kids try to come up with ways to resolve a family feud when Meemaw refuses to give George Sr her secret brisket recipe. US comedy, with Iain Armitage, Lance Barber and Annie Potts, and narrated by Jim Parsons (adult Sheldon in The Big Bang Theory)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010)
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog (2020)
programme.desc: Sonic, a blue hedgehog who can run at supersonic speeds, is transported to Earth. A decade later, while enjoying life in Montana, his speedy skills create an electromagnetic pulse. Scientific genius Dr Robotnik is hired to investigate, and becomes obsessed with capturing the creature for his power. Live-action fantasy adventure based on the video games, starring James Marsden and Jim Carrey, with the voice of Ben Schwartz

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: In an attempt to bond with Sheldon, George Sr takes the boys on a road trip to see the Space Shuttle launch. Meanwhile, Mary, Missy and Meemaw have a girls' weekend at the salon. Narrated by Jim Parsons

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The young genius is forced to help Georgie revise for a maths test when poor grades threaten his brother's future on the football team. In doing so, he manages to pick up a few skills himself. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Montana Jordan

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The young genius moves to Dallas to attend a school for gifted children, the family struggles to cope without him around any more. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny continue testing their rekindled relationship using an innovative system to report discrepancies. Howard and Bernadette begin to worry when Raj starts treating his new phone like a person, while Sheldon and Amy try to achieve internet fame by creating a video podcast about flags

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After a sleepless night, Leonard breaks his room-mate agreement with Sheldon. Howard makes preparations to go on a flight to the International Space Station and enlists Raj's help to ensure he gets a cool astronaut nickname

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon uses his holidays to help Amy in her biology lab, but moans about the menial jobs he is given - until she asks him to dissect a brain. Penny grows curious about Leonard's attitude to marriage when Bernadette asks Howard to sign a pre-nuptial agreement

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Raj and Howard devise a contest to decide whether Sheldon or Kripke should get Professor Rothman's vacant corner office. Meanwhile, Penny receives the gift of a painting from Amy to celebrate their friendship, but discreetly tries to dispose of it with help from Bernadette

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon refuses to get his hair cut as his regular barber is in a coma - a solitary change that causes chaos in the rest of his well-ordered life. Meanwhile, Howard undergoes a gruelling Nasa training programme in Houston, Texas, meaning he can only communicate with Bernadette via the internet

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is disappointed with Sheldon when he announces he is breaking his promise to go with her to a birthday party in favour of joining the boys for a Star Wars video-game marathon. Comedy, starring Mayim Bialik and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon some Star Trek action figures, but the duo refuse to remove them from the packaging in case their value is diminished. Elsewhere, Raj is desperate to find someone to accompany him to a wedding and asks his parents to find him a date. Featuring the guest voice of Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Mary takes care of a bedridden Mandy and Meemaw, while Sheldon learns the university is building a database without him

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Mary clashes with Mandy's mother Audrey, while Sheldon attempts a bit of male bonding

programme.title: Celebs Go Dating
programme.desc: The return of the programme in which famous faces join an exclusive dating agency, this time featuring Chloe Burrows, Vanessa Feltz, Adam Collard, Lottie Moss, Mark-Francis Vandelli and Spuddz. They are thrown straight into a mixer, where they must pluck up the courage to ask strangers out on a date

programme.title: Blockers (2018)
programme.desc: High-school seniors Julie, Kayla and Sam make a pact to lose their virginity on prom night, and Lisa, Mitchell and Hunter are the overprotective parents who try to stop the girls from sealing the deal, no matter what the cost. Comedy, starring Leslie Mann, John Cena and Ike Barinholtz

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Simon passes his driving test, so the lads decide to take a trip to a theme park. However, things start to go wrong when their route is obstructed by a funeral cortege and the newly qualified motorist has an accident in the car park. Later, Will regrets ever making the journey when he disgraces himself on a rollercoaster

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during March 2020, turning their attention to shows including Dragons' Den, Crufts and Antiques Roadshow. ITV drama Liar, Netflix's The Stranger and Channel 4's new dating show Five Guys a Week come under scrutiny, while news coverage of Harry and Meghan and the coronavirus are also appraised

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on programmes including This Morning, Celebrity Mastermind and Race Across the World. Also under consideration are ITV's Liar, Channel 5's The Yorkshire Vet and Channel 4's Hunted. Plus, news coverage of the 'Boris Briefings' and the coronavirus in general

David Lynch's drama, starring Naomi Watts, Justin Theroux, Laura Harring and Robert Forster

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sally fears John Paul might not be ready to go to another night at The Loft, and Sienna assures Ethan she didn't want to tear that family apart and she's told Rafe everything

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Peri tries to get through to Donna-Marie. Elsewhere, Ste pushes Lacey and Nadira closer to each other, and Cindy and Dave spend some time together

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Supercar fanatic Eddie Kaen has spent millions on the design of the Keating in San Diego, California, but neglected to invest in things the guests really need. Gordon Ramsay's visit uncovers empty rooms, a failing restaurant and staff at the end of their tether - leading to a shocking crisis that nobody saw coming

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits Meson de Mesilla, a Tuscan-style hotel in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Owner and former child-star Cali Szczawinski purchased the hotel so she could perform Cher songs every night to a captive audience, but Gordon investigates whether she may be falling flat when it comes to the needs of her guests because she's too busy trying to hit the high notes on stage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: In an attempt to bond with Sheldon, George Sr takes the boys on a road trip to see the Space Shuttle launch. Meanwhile, Mary, Missy and Meemaw have a girls' weekend at the salon. Narrated by Jim Parsons

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Boyle go on an eight-day stakeout, which puts a strain on their friendship. Meanwhile, Jeffords uses Santiago and Gina for inspiration when he writes a book about his daughters, and Captain Holt's nephew visits Brooklyn and makes an instant impression on Diaz. Comedy, guest starring Kyra Sedgwick and Nick Cannon

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The team visits Boyle's beach house on a detectives-only getaway, but Peralta ruins the fun by inviting Captain Holt along. The host helps Diaz to send romantic texts to her new boyfriend Marcus, while Gina amuses herself by trying to get Santiago drunk. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil tries to share his love of dancing with unenthusiastic son Luke and Claire struggles to hide her frustration while teaching an overly cautious Alex to drive. Mitch and Cam enter the cut-throat world of wedding venue booking

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Gloria settles a score with another mum during a school visit, Mitch sets out to prove he is more environmentally aware than his neighbour, Manny and Luke have a double date with twins, and Alex goes to see a therapist. Jesse Eisenberg and Jane Krakowski guest star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Howard are furious when they learn that Sheldon went to work with the military behind their backs. Angered, the pair ask Kripke to help them get their own back on Sheldon, much to his annoyance. Meanwhile, Bernadette suspects that Ruchi might be trying to steal her job while she is on bed rest, so she asks Raj to investigate for her, putting him in a very awkward position. Dean Norris guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys find a laptop that has some virtual currency on it. The only snag is, the computer belongs to Penny's ex-boyfriend Zack. Meanwhile, a seven-year-old video reveals a secret about Leonard and Penny's relationship

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny and Leonard try to distract Sheldon from his career woes by reinstating Anything Can Happen Thursday, but it causes friction among the gang when Amy and Bernadette are caught lying. Meanwhile, Raj seeks Howard's help in preparing for a date with Emily. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang's preparations for Star Wars Day are interrupted by the news that Professor Proton has died. Leonard and Penny attend the funeral, where they talk about their rejected marriage proposals, but Sheldon has difficulty dealing with the death of his childhood hero - until a surprise visitor helps him cope with his grief. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with a guest appearance by Bob Newhart

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave decides to disconnect the Johnson home from the grid and inadvertently causes a community-wide power outage, much to Calvin's frustration

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin soon regrets agreeing to Dave's suggestion for how to promote his business. Gemma asks Tina to rescue her struggling after-school music programme

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The gang members get together to have their family photo taken, with Gloria on hand to organise everyone. and Phil tracks down the record he lost his virginity to, but soon regrets it when it makes him feel as if he's being unfaithful to Claire. She, meanwhile, accuses Cameron of being a snob when he refuses her daughter's hand-me-downs, and Jay enters Stella into a dog show

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam worry about the growing cost of their wedding, so they agree to each sell a prized possession to earn some extra cash. Jay, Gloria and Manny challenge one another to step outside their comfort zones, involving traditional sausages, pickle and Stella's belly, while the Dunphy kids are in a mischievous mood after finding an old answering machine recording of Claire breaking the news that she's pregnant

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake is excited to work a case with the best detective in the NYPD, Dave Majors - until his colleague shares his intentions to ask Amy out on a date. Rosa's surprising fashion choice causes a stir, and Charles and Gina make an unexpected discovery. Comedy, with Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Holt begins to worry he is being set up for a fall by one of his superiors, and Peralta is handed the chance to work on an important case. Meanwhile, Jeffords tries to make sure his twins get a place at their chosen school. Comedy, with Andy Samberg and Terry Crews

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard tries to use his wedding as an excuse to avoid being sent into space, but ends up accepting the mission. Amy plots to get Sheldon to take the next step in their relationship, while Leonard accidentally asks Penny to marry him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Howard and his fellow astronauts sit in the space shuttle awaiting launch, he reflects on the tumultuous events of the previous few days, when he and Bernadette tried to get married. Meanwhile, his friends witness the blast-off on TV at home

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets the opportunity to spend time with Bill Gates at work, because his business wants to partner with her pharmaceutical company. Leonard, Howard and Raj do everything in their power to also meet the high-tech entrepreneur, while Sheldon thinks he's the victim of an April Fool's Day prank

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard runs against Sheldon to be president of the tenants' association, while Bernadette encourages Howard and Raj to track down the owner of a drone they find in the back garden

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Rayne opens up to her boyfriend about her childhood trauma, Lacey decides to be true to her feelings, and Cindy decides that she doesn't need a man

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The youngster asks for a computer and unknowingly sparks a heated argument between his parents over the family's finances, prompting Mary and the twins to move in with Meemaw. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: At Greg's request, Little Alex Horne splits his band five ways for the sake of a task, and Kiell Smith-Bynoe composes a solo entitled 'Compose a Solo'

programme.title: Celebs Go Dating
programme.desc: At the agency, Chloe Burrows gets emotional when she talks about her ex, and Vanessa Feltz opens up about her heartache surrounding her ex Ben Ofoedu

programme.title: Cruel Summer
programme.desc: The annual Wallis hunting trip reminds Kate that she can't fully trust those closest to her and that, try as she might, the past always has a way of catching up

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The locked-down armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Jamie Oliver's Keep Cooking and Carry On, Celebrity Murder Mystery, Joe Wicks on The Andrew Marr Show, The Nest, This Morning with dog yoga, The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer; Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip and news coverage of the coronavirus. From April 2020

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Singers Claire and Louise arrive at the restaurant to provide a bit of moral support to each other, making a foursome with Mathew, who works in a supermarket, and engineering manager Scott. But there's confusion over who will be dating who. Meanwhile, 22-year-old Aryeh hopes fellow student Jack will not be put off by his overwhelming personality and 60-year-old Meryl from Wirral is looking for someone to keep up with her when she goes clubbing. Will Whitchurch divorcee Andrew be up for a dance?

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys spare no shame when they go bowling, and take part in a potato scoop challenge which proves harder than they thought

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The jokers complete tasks on an escalator, two losers open a rock concert, and there is chaos in the supermarket

programme.title: Celebs Go Dating
programme.desc: At the agency, Chloe Burrows gets emotional when she talks about her ex, and Vanessa Feltz opens up about her heartache surrounding her ex Ben Ofoedu

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny and Leonard try to distract Sheldon from his career woes by reinstating Anything Can Happen Thursday, but it causes friction among the gang when Amy and Bernadette are caught lying. Meanwhile, Raj seeks Howard's help in preparing for a date with Emily. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang's preparations for Star Wars Day are interrupted by the news that Professor Proton has died. Leonard and Penny attend the funeral, where they talk about their rejected marriage proposals, but Sheldon has difficulty dealing with the death of his childhood hero - until a surprise visitor helps him cope with his grief. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with a guest appearance by Bob Newhart

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: In an attempt to bond with Sheldon, George Sr takes the boys on a road trip to see the Space Shuttle launch. Meanwhile, Mary, Missy and Meemaw have a girls' weekend at the salon. Narrated by Jim Parsons

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The young genius is forced to help Georgie revise for a maths test when poor grades threaten his brother's future on the football team. In doing so, he manages to pick up a few skills himself. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Montana Jordan

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Dre talks about getting a gun after a neighbourhood break-in, but Rainbow is not comfortable with the idea. Andre Jr becomes determined to protect the family from cyberterrorism

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: When Dre struggles to cope with his yearly medical examination, Pops admits that he hasn't seen a doctor in years

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The meets a pair of newlyweds who instead of a honeymoon spent their money on an old army truck, which they plan to transform into a mobile holiday home, and a master craftsman in Dorset making an eco-friendly luxury treehouse - complete with sauna, spiral staircase and even a slide. In New Zealand, George visits a hilltop beach house overlooking the Pacific, and as ever he and old friend Will Hardie embark on another series-long project - this time to build a gravity-defying, rotating home inspired by vintage sci-fi comics

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George is joined by leading architects to help transform some of Britain's most unloved houses into desirable properties. In the village of Claverdon, Warwickshire, Steve and Celine's are embarrassed by their 1960s A-frame house. Having remained untouched for nearly 50 years, it is stuck in a time warp and is falling apart at the seams. George Clarke enlisted the help of architect Graeme Williamson to drag the house into the 21st century and make it fit for a family of five. Steve and Celine already have their own ideas - but can Graeme convince them to buy into his ambitious architectural vision?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George returns to a grand Victorian villa in Ormskirk to follow the next stage of its renovation. Having previously created a luxurious master en suite, his next task is to tackle the giant kitchen and utility area. He also visits a typical Victorian mansion block in London. Although structurally sound, the flat has been virtually untouched over the years. The result is dismal and depressing with a spare room that feels like a prison cell. Can George mastermind a plan to free up this criminal waste of space?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around Belfast, where the first host is chatty PR manager Claire. She aims to impress with a menu made up of her favourite restaurant dishes, but never having plucked a pheasant before, she has a challenge on her hands. The guests she's hoping to impress are DJ Ryan, joiner and part-time inventor Neil, charity events manager Cailin, and window cleaning manager Paul, on a lively night filled with laughter, music and dancing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Neil hosts the second dinner party in and around Belfast in a bid to win the £1000 prize, presenting good old fashioned, country style cuisine to his guests. With a farmyard full of animals joining in the fun, discussions ranging from disabled chickens to eating stinging nettles and a guest performance from Neil's very own creation, ''head in a jar', it's proves to be a weird and wonderful experience out in the countryside

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debonair window cleaning business owner and keen golfer Paul has cut a dash already this week in and around Belfast with his sense of style, and now he hopes to impress with his fine food. For Ryan and Neil, most of the fancy fare is uncharted territory, and while Cailin and Claire are impressed with the fine dining, Paul sails close to the wind when he suggests that they might like to be his ladies-in-waiting

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Livewire DJ and events organiser Ryan is the next to host in and around Belfast - and having arranged parties for thousands, is confident he can satisfy four fellow diners. Eccentric joiner Neil anticipates a madcap evening of fun, and with a hipster band playing in the living room, unexpected discoveries in the bedroom and several crises in the kitchen, certainly gets the entertainment he was hoping for

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Belfast, Cailin hosts a Eurovision extravaganza. Her rivals have provided top-notch nosh and entertainment, but she believes that her tried-and-tested dishes from across Europe will land her the top spot

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent, where James Tindall and Jessica Walton hope to impress their guests and be named best value for money

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, boasting stylish shepherd huts, and run by mother and daughter duo Amanda Benton and Becci Howlett

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The White House in Swansea, where guests James and Jessica have an unusual toilet encounter in their room

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. The Ship Inn is up first, with managers James Tindall and Jessica Walton wanting to let off steam about the surprise comments that made their visit a heated affair

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the West Midlands, the first host, company director Sue, promises an evening her guests will never forget. Joining her are business guru Marc, teaching assistant Kim, manager Paul and mole catcher Michael. Sue hopes to get things off to a great start, but when her starter reminds Kim of baby food and Marc of toilets, things begin to look bleak

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the West Midlands, business guru Marc intends to use his coaching skills to plan an impressive night, but after annoying his fellow diners, he has a tough job ahead

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teaching assistant Kim hopes to win over her guests with a summer holiday-themed evening, as she hosts the third dinner party of the week in the West Midlands

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: College manager and part-time comedian Paul is the fourth to play host in the West Midlands, turning his home into a pub in the hope of pulling in the points by pulling a few pints

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the last night in the West Midlands, and mole-catcher Michael intends to impress his guests with his night of fancy French cuisine, including a controversial main course

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman hits her head collapsing in a bus shelter, and a paramedic with a phobia of mannequins is watched over by two life-size dolls while treating a man with chest pains. An 11-month-old ends up with a deep cut to his forehead, and a 90-year-old man with stabbing pains in his chest asks the paramedics to just let him go if it's serious

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Jade from Kent is brought in after being hit by a car and knocked under a bus on her way to school, and doctors are concerned the 12-year-old may have fractured her skull. Meanwhile, Geraldine, 60, has been injured while trying to cross the road, and after recently being released from prison 40-year-old Brian is in minors with a broken ankle, but the swelling means his electronic curfew tag will have to be removed

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Fiona must stop a young man's heart beating in order to save him. A patient with a gruesome head wound has Dr Sarah on full alert, and nurse Julie helps a smitten young couple who spend most of their first date in the emergency ward

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Heli-medics scramble to the Peak District, where a dirt-buggy smash has left a rider with serious injuries. A farm worker tears his arm using a potato harvester, and Daryl receives three rapid shocks as the medics race to his aid amid concerns of a cardiac arrest

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Glassman struggles to get the post-operation rest he needs while confronting his relationship with his daughter. Murphy and Reznick are left in charge of the emergency room

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman hits her head collapsing in a bus shelter, and a paramedic with a phobia of mannequins is watched over by two life-size dolls while treating a man with chest pains. An 11-month-old ends up with a deep cut to his forehead, and a 90-year-old man with stabbing pains in his chest asks the paramedics to just let him go if it's serious
