Jade from Kent is brought in after being hit by a car and knocked under a bus on her way to school, and doctors are concerned the 12-year-old may have fractured her skull. Meanwhile, Geraldine, 60, has been injured while trying to cross the road, and after recently being released from prison 40-year-old Brian is in minors with a broken ankle, but the swelling means his electronic curfew tag will have to be removed

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jane and Jilly from Brighton look for a holiday home in the Dordogne region of south-west France. Laura Hamilton shows them five suitable properties for their £100,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enlists the help of paper-cutting expert Poppy Chancellor to make personalised wedding invitations for a couple about to tie the knot. Plus, the inventive presenter creates a craft collage to celebrate the arrival of a newborn baby

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies is on Spain's Costa Blanca house-hunting around the vibrant resort of Villamartin with Amanda and Steve, who want to buy a holiday home where they can spend the winter months golfing, socialising and soaking up the sun. Danni has been given a budget of £85,000, with which she finds five properties that she thinks fits the bill. Will Amanda and Steve love one of them sufficiently to buy it?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A former DJ from Skegness opens a bar in Portugal, but falls foul of the law, while a couple's renovation of a B&B in Italy continues with one of them stuck in Wales

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Dumfries and Galloway to memorabilia heaven. Simon spots an unloved corner unit at a charity depot that he plans on upcycling

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Pembrokeshire to meet a cattle breeder whose barns include a pair of discarded horns, and a camper van fan with a vintage pedal car

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A company is contacted by a man who is trying to track down the rest of his family after his cousin dies, and the beneficiaries of a Roman Catholic priest's will embark on a journey to learn about his remarkable dedication to his Manchester parish. Plus, details of more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Shelley Guest House in Aberystwyth, where its husband-and-wife owners hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money by providing their guests with an old-school form of entertainment, some Spanish cuisine and a monumental continental breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests travel to the five-star Ixworth House in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, where hosts John and Sharyn Snell are quietly confident their establishment will impress. John reveals his hidden talents at dinner, but his performance at breakfast the next morning does not go down well with all of the fellow B&B owners

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In York, part-time panto dame Graham Smith runs the Georgian House & Mews, and takes his guests back in time with a Nordic test of strength. At supper, Hazel has romance on her mind, but the guests are left to fend for themselves at breakfast - until Graham makes a show-stopping appearance

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the George Hotel in Orton, Cumbria, for the fourth visit of the day. Owner Hazel McAleese organises a fishing trip as the afternoon activity, during which one of the guests decides to use the opportunity to give everyone a lesson in innuendo

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the contest reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Alcorn family in Peebles in the Scottish Borders. The family of four lives in a conservation area and while dad Dave loves their grey-stone Victorian villa for its picture-book charm, mum Amy despises its lack of practicality. With no off-road parking, no third bedroom and no downstairs bathroom - not to mention the small, draughty kitchen - she has quite a list. Would it be best to simply move on to one of the new properties picked out by Phil, or can Kirstie come up with a way of making their home work?

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chester's chimps have lacked a dominant female for several years. Vila seems ready for the role, until she is attacked by Alice, a higher-ranking female. Four-year-old Sumatran tiger Kasarna is living in the shadow of her domineering mum Kirana. But if she is ever to mature into a healthy breeding female, she needs to find some confidence and make her own mark

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Elaine is paired with Hayley the blue Staffy, and a family has the pick of two dogs - Rusty the kelpie and Lightning the Australian terrier cross

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Zimbabwean-born Davi and Matt from Australia, who are determined to create a home to reflect their backgrounds, so set out to build a house in the Chess Valley with a radical multicultural design, which is especially daring for their commuter-belt suburb. Despite their inexperience and the technical difficulty of the steeply sloping site, Davi and Matt manage the venture themselves. But it's not long before the problems begin

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix takes a culinary tour of Rome with Michelin-starred chef Giorgio Locatelli. They head for the Vatican City in search of one of the most unusual cheap eats money can buy, courtesy of legendary pizza maker Gabrielle Bonci. Giorgio takes Fred out of the city centre to one of Rome's finest trattorias, and discovers how much the city's food scene owes to keeping old traditions alive

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: In New York, the TWA Hotel is close by the John F Kennedy International Airport. Its interiors hark back to the spirit of the 1960s jet age, but with a 21st-century twist. Here, visitors can check in at the old baggage check and enjoy dining in what used to be an airport lounge. In Finnish Lapland, visitors to the snow-capped forest of the Urho Kekkonen National Park can spend a night sleeping under the stars at the Kakslauttanen Arctic Resort. This getaway boasts 65 state-of-the-art, arctic-resistant glass igloos. There are also visits to unique and unusual hotels in Canada and Scotland

programme.title: The Billion Pound Hotel
programme.desc: Shaped like a giant sail and standing more than 1,000ft tall, the Burj Al Arab in Dubai cost an estimated £1billion to build, and has been dubbed the world's most luxurious hotel. Guests paying anything up to £10,000 a night expect only the highest of standards, so what does it take for the staff to satisfy these demanding customers? This programme follows the stories of a variety of visitors, from the King of Uganda to a firefighter who has saved up months of wages, and the workers who serve them

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Heli-medics in the East Midlands race to free Valerie from her car after it was t-boned by a lorry. In Norwich, the medics rush to the aid of 15-year-old Henry who's fallen 20 feet when a large kite dragged him off his feet into the air, and medics suspect Ellana may have a serious head injury after a road traffic collision in Leicester trapped her in her vehicle

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics brave harsh weather to respond to emergency calls, including a driver who crashed on the icy M6 and a woman in police custody who keeps losing consciousness

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Medics at King's College Hospital treat 79-year-old Arthur, who has been brought into resus with acute stomach discomfort and has several underlying conditions that could be to blame. Meanwhile, 20-year-old wine merchant Tom is rushed into A&E after collapsing with sharp chest pains and breathing difficulties, and retired soldier Rockey is concerned about his blurred vision

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Cheshire couple Alison and Stephen Bulger find a holiday home in the charming town of Marseillan in the South of France for their £115,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: In this bite-sized episode, Kirstie Allsopp plans to surprise her guests with two main courses - roast beef with mulled wine gravy, and masala cauliflower with coconut stuffing for the vegetarians

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Julia and Warren from Sunderland are relocating to the stunning Andalucian countryside near the picturesque town of Alora. They think the region's sunny climate will work wonders for their health and are looking for a cottage with plenty of outside space for fruit trees and keeping honey bees. Scarlette Douglas helps them find the perfect property for their £95,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple with a new B&B argue over renovations, a family of brewers from Kent dash across the Channel to beat lockdown, and a restaurateur from Skegness' finances hang by a thread

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Gemma turns an old TV cabinet into a luxury dog bed, while Henry trades in his lifelong love of mechanicals to upcycle wooden furniture

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Oxford to meet Rosemary, whose father owned a second-hand goods shop. They discover a servant's call bell and a mysterious pedal-powered tool, which Simon is anxious to restore

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives are on the road in Southampton as they try to track down multiple beneficiaries to the estate of a local market trader worth more than £100,000. Meanwhile, another firm's investigation reveals a family's historical links to the beginnings of professional sport

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Angel Inn in Wangford, Suffolk, where husband-and-wife owners Peter and Christine hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, a self-service breakfast fails to impress the guests, and Christine struggles to keep her cool as confusion reigns in the kitchen

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second night of the competition moves to Moaps Farm in Dane Hill, East Sussex, where Lesley Miller hopes her guests will be charmed by her laid-back attitude. On arrival, the group is wowed by the view, but at breakfast the host's relaxed approach leads to disaster and some of her fellow B&B owners are forced to help out with the service

programme.desc: From Jabajak in Carmarthenshire, Wales, where sisters Lorraine Lloyd and Amanda Stuart-Robson host in their vineyard and restaurant B&B. The quality of the food gets good reviews at breakfast, although the guests poke fun at the crockery, and at feedback time criticism comes from an unexpected source and leaves the owner reconsidering his views of his rivals

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp try to help a couple living in a flat on the River Thames in central London, who disagree on whether they should move. Gareth and Tina have owned the property for 10 years and Tina loves being within walking distance of work, schools, clubs and all the sights, but Gareth wants a big family home and Phil finds a detached house with a pool to tempt the family into the suburbs

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Young Moellendorff rat snake Sen is about to face male Jakob on her first ever date. But with snakes often eating the other one for dinner, will he be hungry for love or just hungry? The keepers are concerned about the health of orangutan Sarikei and Rothschild's giraffe Dagmar - both of whom have youngsters to care for - an otter pup is struggling to eat and struggling to walk

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Sammy the Jack Russell, known for his excessively wiggly bum, could just be exactly what reserved youngster Alex needs. Neglect victim Martin the Staffy may finally find the home he deserves

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: For most people, living in a lighthouse is pure fantasy. Not so for Edward and Hazel Short and their two young daughters. Back in 2012, they set out to build a brand new, art deco, shining white lighthouse tower with additional bedrooms, guest rooms, and infinity pool on the side - all on a rugged but beautiful clifftop in North Devon. Kevin McCloud sees if they made that dream a reality

programme.title: Titanic: Building the World's Largest Ship
programme.desc: The untold story of the doomed steamship's construction, revealing how 15,000 men toiled day and night in life-threatening conditions to create a state-of-the-art floating city. Based on original blueprints and unseen archives, cutting-edge special effects bring this process back to life on screen, and explore how the outsize ambitions that made it all possible also led to the ship's dramatic demise

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: The Aberdeen trauma team are dispatched by air to 52-year-old Mark, who is trapped after crashing and rolling his van into farmland. programme.desc: This edition sees staff at King's College Hospital in south London treat patients involved in serious road accidents. programme.title: The Emergency Ward

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a range of cases including a man who wraps his pick-up truck around a tree, a man who is having severe chest pain that could be a sign of a heart attack and a 103-year-old who has had a fall. Plus, a grandmother who may have a bleed on the brain and a mother with heart failure seek urgent medical treatment

Former soldier Steve, 48, was found unconscious at the wheel, 11-year-old schoolgirl Scarlett has been knocked down by a car, and Pauline, 70, was hit by a vehicle that mounted the pavement, seriously injuring her lower legs

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Joe and Emma from Kent have been married for 21 years. After years of holidaying in Spain, they've decided to sell up in the UK and make a permanent move along with their daughter Gracie to Spain's Mar Menor. Armed with a budget of £90,000, Ben Hillman sets out to find the pair the perfect property

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Rob loves the great outdoors and is after the perfect lifestyle vehicle. Rebecca thinks Jaguar and Jeep but Elo asks Rob a different question

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Elo and Rebecca search for a vehicle for an 18-year-old DJ who likes mod-cons and fast cars

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef visits Palermo in northern Sicily, a city echoing Arab, North African, French, Spanish and Italian influences, making its cuisine unique and irresistible. Pine nuts, raisins, almonds and golden breadcrumbs are combined with flavours of sun-ripened tomatoes, lemons and the finest olive oil to create a range of unforgettable dishes. Rick witnesses locals celebrating a festival in honour of Palermo's patron saint Rosalia, and receives a cookery lesson from a real-life duchess. At home he cooks Marsala chicken, a Sicilian classic served in UK bistros since the 1960s

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are each challenged to find a classic car at auction for £3,000. Exploring whether they are more fun to drive than modern alternatives, the trio then take the vehicles to Majorca to compete in a rally. Jeremy also test-drives the BMW Z4 and Nissan 370Z, and AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May are challenged to create a TV advert for Volkswagen, but soon fall out as James concentrates on detailed information on fuel economy and Jeremy wants something more exciting. Richard Hammond explores an alternative to Germanic sports saloons and tests the Vauxhall VXR8 Bathurst, and former US chat show host Jay Leno is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Repair Lot
programme.desc: A VW Buggy has shaky steering and a grouchy gearchange, and a fast Ford has suffered a bad rear-end shunt and needs new bodywork and a respray

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo visits Rome, and wastes no time in sourcing the pancetta and guanciale he needs to rustle up a traditional pasta carbonara in front of the Colosseum. He then heads to Ariccia, a small town on the outskirts of the Italian capital, to sample porchetta - slow-roasted boneless pork stuffed with seasoning and rosemary - before concluding this leg of his culinary journey by cooking a Roman-inspired dish of pan-fried lamb in rosemary and honey sauce with fennel salad

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo returns to his native Campania - the region in which he grew up and where his family still lives. As a chef, he is eager to visit Gragnano - a town famed for its pasta - and during his time touring the area he is given a masterclass in the art of hand-rolling fusilli. He then takes a trip to the picturesque orchards nearby, and picks some succulent red cherries that inspire him to create a tiramisu with a contemporary twist. Before moving on, Gino decides to do something he has never done before - cook for his Italian relatives - so he serves up a dish of salmon in a spicy arrabiata sauce with some of Gragnano's legendary pasta

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: There's just one question on everyone's lips this time... can anyone climb Mount Midoriyama? The best of the Ninjas go head to head in Part 2 of the Series 2 Grand Final

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Tintagel, Cornwall's most mythical place, which was an important trading port with Europe and the birthplace of perhaps Britain's greatest legend - the tale of King Arthur. He also learns how the Methodists were important to Cornwall, and how they would cook a rather unusual bun during feast days, and meets a family on the Roseland Peninsula who are continuing the surprisingly ancient tradition of growing an exotic spice - saffron

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the rich and diverse history of West Penwith, the farthest point west in mainland Britain. He visits Lamorna Cove, made famous through song and art, and the Unesco-protected tin and copper mining area of Botallack, where he talks to a mining explorer. The chef also follows an ancient track in search of Cornwall's oldest building and reveals how, as a young lad on the Lizard Peninsula, he fell in love for the first time and tasted his first French fish stew - known as a bouillabaisse

programme.title: Churchill's Secret Son
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Tipperary-born businessman and Conservative cabinet minister Brendan Bracken, who became Winston Churchill's right-hand man during the Second World War by opposing efforts to appease Adolf Hitler. The film considers the possibility of a biological connection between the two men

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: In Poland lies a forgotten Nazi complex which could have sheltered up to 27,244 people from Allied bombs, the purpose of which largely remains a mystery

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Churchill's plan to attack Germany through Italy. Although considered the simplest military solution, the Allies were to face formidable opposition, while the Americans met the Wehrmacht for the first time. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next leg of his journey, Michael Portillo heads along the Essex bank of the Thames before crossing the river into Kent. He begins in Barkingside, where Victorian philanthropist Thomas Barnardo made it his mission to transform the lives of destitute children. The former politician then tries his hand at loading a container onto a pocket wagon at Tilbury docks, and ends his trip in Rochester, where he encounters a host of familiar characters and explores a town that was an inspiration for many of Charles Dickens' works

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo starts the next leg of his journey to Chichester in Faversham, Kent, where he visits Shepherd Neame, which is one of the oldest breweries in Britain. He then heads to Dover to explore a sunken fortress known as the Western Heights, before crossing into Surrey where he blow-dries a hen in Dorking

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Brighton as he starts the final leg of his journey from Norwich to Chichester, learning about the history of the Royal Pavilion. At Bramber, he discovers that Victorian tourists flocked to the town in huge numbers to visit a museum of taxidermy, before heading into the South Downs for a taste of life in the fast lane at Goodwood

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Ayr as he embarks on the first leg of a journey through southern Scotland from west to east, admiring the granite island of Ailsa Craig in the Firth of Clyde before getting to grips with the sport of curling, with a little help from a Scottish world champion. The Ancient Society of Kilwinning Archers invites Michael to take part in a competition, at Barassie he rides the footplate of a freight train hauling coal on Scotland's oldest railway line as he heads on towards Stewarton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through southern Scotland, with this leg beginning in the industrial town of Greenock, from where he sets sail in the world's last sea-going paddle steamer. He then sees the devastating effects of a fire at the Glasgow School of Art, heads to Blantyre to find out about the humble beginnings of a famous missionary and explorer and learns to make sourdough in a bakery in Strathaven before finishing his trip in Larkhall

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Motherwell as he continues his journey through southern Scotland, celebrating the Victorian iron and steel industry and admires one of its crowning achievements - the Forth Rail Bridge. He then visits the Falls of Clyde, which inspired Wordsworth and Coleridge, heads to Cumbernauld to learn about the origins of one of Scotland's best-selling soft drinks, and in Linlithgow he marvels at the ingenuity of the engineers who built the Union Canal

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his journey in Stirling, where he visits the scene of the Battle of Bannockburn before travelling north to Crieff in Perth and Kinross to take in a Victorian spa. In Perth, he finds out how to make a sporran and catches the Highland Main Line to Pitlochry and one of Queen Victoria's favourite haunts, then finishes with a dram in Scotland's smallest distillery

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the final leg of his journey across southern Scotland from west to east, beginning by paying homage to the birthplace of golf at St Andrews. In Dunfermline, he learns about the humble origins of a remarkable philanthropist who worked on the railroads before making his fortune in steel, and then crosses the Forth Bridge to end his trip in Edinburgh, where he treads the boards in an unconventional adaptation of a play by Oscar Wilde at the Festival Fringe

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris sets out on a mission to cross three former Soviet republics entirely by rail in just one week, travelling through Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania and uncovering amazing stories and dark secrets from the region's past. He begins in Narva, Estonia, before heading to the capital Tallinn on the country's oldest railway, built by German nobles to connect the Russian imperial capital St Petersburg with Estonia's ports, then travelling through Latvia and Lithuania and heading to the Russian border on a revolutionary new line

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris Tarrant explores five countries that were part of Yugoslavia, which had an extensive state-run railway network before its break-up in the 1990s and the Balkan Wars of Independence that followed. From Slovenia, Chris heads east along an old Austro-Hungarian railway that was once used by the Orient Express, pays a visit to a very unusual railway-related battlefield in Bosnia and rides on one of the world's great mountain railways on his way to the Serbian capital Belgrade before finishing his journey in Montenegro

programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Grantham Arms in Boroughbridge, North Yorkshire. The guests are dazzled by the décor, and enjoy a day out visiting a mystical cave

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Carl Insley and best friend Sharon are the hosts at Driftwood Luxury Lodges in Dale Abbey in Derbyshire, where they offer a luxury glamping experience. The stylish home-made furniture is a hit, although one camper notices it might not be very practical, and while the continental breakfast is a hit with one couple, others find it hard to swallow

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hoteliers head to Southport, where husband and wife Rick and Sarah Blaney run the Stamford. However, things do not get off to a great start when Annelies and Claudia are left out in the cold by the self check-in

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother-and-daughter team Annelies and Claudia Richardson host the week's last visit at the Fauconberg Arms in Coxwold, North Yorkshire. Their ethos is that food is just as important as the rooms, but this threatens to prove their downfall when Rick and Sarah have reservations about cleanliness

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On Payment Day, Carl is keen to quiz Simon and Joe over their breakfast woes, while Rick and Sarah want to know why they were scored so badly for their hosting skills. Meanwhile, Annelies and Claudia from the Fauconberg Arms want to wipe the slate with Sarah and Rick's cleanliness critique

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman assists Pat and Anya Rich, who are looking for a holiday home on Florida's southern Gulf Coast where they can spend family time with their seven-year-old daughter Sofia. With a budget of £150,000, Ben shows them five impressive properties, but will any of them live up to their dream?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas goes property-searching around Naples, one of the most stylish cities along Florida's Gulf Coast, for house-hunters Trever and Reiss, who have £350,000 to spend on a holiday home to invest in a home in the area

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Horse-lovers Mel and James seek a holiday home in Mijas Pueblo in southern Spain. Laura Hamilton shows them the best of what their £180,000 budget can get them with five impressive properties, hoping that at least one will have them chomping at the bit

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman shows Pat Strachen from Aberdeen and her daughter Rachel five properties in Tenerife for her budget of £130,000. After holidaying on her favourite Canary Island for over 25 years, Pat now wants to take the plunge and spend her retirement there. It's a big, life-changing move, so can Jasmine find her that perfect home in the sun?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Jean Johansson helps Trish and her sister Ann find a holiday home along the coastline in southern Cyprus. Trish's dream is to find her perfect two-bedroomed property where she can holiday a couple of times a year with family and friends, and most importantly, enjoy the island's warm winters. With a budget of £90,000, Jean lines up five attractive options for the pair

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies pulls out all the stops to find Vicky and Lee from Northamptonshire their perfect holiday home around Málaga in Spain to enjoy with their three children and dog

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Staff at Woodgreen animal charity set out to match their homeless dogs with prospective owners. Deaf parents Hannah and Craig and their mischievous boys Oliver and Felix meet cheeky cockapoo puppy Percy. Tiny Yorkie terrier pair Lola and Bailey show size doesn't matter when there are two of you - especially with the backing of Woodgreen's dog behaviour expert Sue

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol (2011)
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt and his team are implicated in a bombing at the Kremlin, forcing the American president to declare them fugitives. The spies plan to clear their name by abducting the real terrorist, which leads them into a pursuit around the globe. However, Hunt cannot be sure his colleagues are trustworthy. Action adventure sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg and Paula Patton

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr, Susie Dent and Rachel Riley host a compilation of best bits from the anarchic letters and numbers game, featuring Sean Lock, Jon Richardson, Harry Hill, Bob Mortimer, Katherine Ryan, Joe Lycett, Rose Matafeo, Richard Ayoade, Chris McCausland, Miles Jupp, Lucy Beaumont, Alex Horne and Joe Wilkinson among others

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the panel show, joined by celebrity guests including Rob Beckett, Richard Ayoade, Rosie Jones, Roisin Conaty, Mawaan Rizwan and Joanne McNally. Charles Dance heads up a cast of celebrity question-setters, posing puzzling queries on the world's hottest chilli, deodorants, bomb disposal dogs, and what Ringo Starr does not want people to do

programme.title: The Girl from Plainville
programme.desc: The defense hopes the testimony of Dr. Breggin will clinch Michelle's acquittal. Co struggles with regret. Coco relies on Michelle to maneuver through his suicidal ideations. Michelle is still haunted by the past, and the verdict is read

programme.title: The Girl from Plainville
programme.desc: The final episode of this drama inspired by Michelle Carter's 'texting-suicide' case, exploring her relationship with Conrad Roy III and the events that led to his death and her conviction for involuntary manslaughter. Coco's last day unfolds, Michelle struggles with the future, and the Carters and Roys both try to find closure after the tragedy. Elle Fanning stars

programme.title: Beat the Chef
programme.desc: Recruitment consultant Megan Kent goes head to head with chef Frederick Forster with her egg yolk-filled ravioli, in an attempt to tantalise the jury's taste buds and win the cash

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five strangers from from in and around the Hampshire town of Basingstoke compete to host the best dinner party. Marketing manager and maths enthusiast Nicole is first up with a foodie journey that takes her guests from Lebanon back to the UK via the Caribbean. Will company director Adam, winery worker Izzy, DJ, poet and business owner Mark and cleaning company owner Chris be inpressed by their host's efforts?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second host from in and around Basingstoke, business owner Adam, hopes to impress his guests with authentic Mexican cuisine, inspired by a holiday to a resort in Cancún

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the third night in Basingstoke, DJ and nutritionist Mark goes down the festival route with both his food and the entertainment, and offers his guests his own filtered water

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Basingstoke finds winery worker Izzy planning a sophisticated evening, though whether her fancy approach will prove too much of a risk remains to be seen. DJ and nutritionist Mark irritates Izzy by not sticking to her dress code, while Adam and Chris embrace the black-tie event. Will the self-confessed queen of dinner parties give the guests a night to remember and put herself in the top spot, or will the sophistication be too much for some?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final host from in and around the Hampshire town of Basingstoke is snappy dresser Chris, who hopes to impress his guests with a '90s music dress code and a menu of French dishes made with local produce. Chris has been disappointed with the standard of cooking all week and plans to take it up a notch for the final night, but there's simmering tensions between Mark and well-spoken Izzy

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: In France, cameras catch up with the owners of a motorhome rental business about to hit the fast lane. In Spain, there is a return to a cycling retreat business, whose owners have been forced to rethink their business model thanks to the impact of Covid

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi offers more advice to people buying a second property abroad, this time helping to find the perfect holiday home to be shared by three sisters and their brother in the Poitou-Charentes region of south-western France

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: With retirement five years away, Graham and Janet Gifford, from Wigan, want to buy a holiday home that they can eventually relocate to permanently in the Italian region of Liguria. Armed with a budget of £80,000, Sara Damergi helps the couple navigate the Italian property market

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This week's competition kicks off in Nottingham, where the first host, 26-year-old glam local DJ Janelle, opts for an evening dedicated to her Jamaican heritage

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the second night in Nottingham, proud vegetarian Dom throws an animal-themed night with a vegan menu. The group talk about how far they have gone for love and Jon shocks the group with a story about a failed relationship

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Tamika uses her party planner skills to prove she is the hostess with the mostest. In the second carnival-themed dinner party of the week, the host throws a limbo competition in hopes of being crowned Queen of the carnival

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The penultimate host in Nottingham is beautician Cherie, who is hoping to charm her way to the £1,000 prize. Cherie serves up some traditional pub grub and throws in a pampering sesh for her lucky guests - but will it be enough to bag her the grand?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night in Nottingham sees sales manager Jon throw an Italian-themed evening in a bid to win the £1,000 prize. His guests are impressed when Jon reveals that he has made the wine he's serving, but Cherie and Tamika struggle to guess the key ingredients. With the party in full flow, Janelle reveals not one but two surprises including a royal connection and her very own 'superpower'

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies pulls out all the stops to find Vicky and Lee from Northamptonshire their perfect holiday home around Málaga in Spain to enjoy with their three children and dog

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies finds five potential properties for Jill Castling, who has dreamt of owning a family holiday home in Barbados for as long as she can remember

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect meets art deco fan Ododu, who's downsized to a Victorian terrace in Brighton but is at a loss about how to connect the kitchen to the garden. For inspiration, he visits Eltham Palace, a showstopping example of deco glamour. George also heads to Stockport, Greater Manchester, to help Sarah, who has just inherited the home she grew up in following her mother's death. With a new baby on the way, she's trying to make the 1890s red brick home work for modern family life, while still preserving some of the features that remind her of her mum

programme.title: Millionaire Hoarders
programme.desc: Car fanatic John decides to part with some of his beloved collection to help fund his retirement. Expert and fellow petrol-head Clive spots two classic cars in John's collection that could raise a huge sum, but will his gamble on an auction sale pay off? In the West Country, Rachel and Ronnie help Caroline, who inherited an inn from her father but has made the difficult decision to part with some of its weird and wonderful contents in order to invest on the building. Ronnie spots a rare animal pelt that could be the solution to Caroline's problems - if he can prove it's authentic

programme.title: Emergency
programme.desc: Documentary series following the London Major Trauma System. An air ambulance, paramedics and fire crews are dispatched to 49-year-old Paiwand, a pedestrian trapped underneath a lorry in south London, and race against time to treat his crush injuries. Thirteen-year-old Alicia has a large gaping wound on the back of her leg after crashing an electric scooter into a lamp post. Ralph, an 84-year-old with a broken femur, faces complex surgery with a 50-50 chance of survival

programme.title: Emergency
programme.desc: Eighty-four-year-old Ralph heads in to a surgery with a 50-50 chance of survival. After being crushed against metal railings then thrown into the basement of a Mayfair property, 33-year-old Zoltan had his leg amputated and now needs an operation on his pelvis to give him any chance of walking on a prosthetic leg. Kent Surrey and Sussex Air Ambulance bring 42-year-old Karl into King's Major Trauma Centre after a collision on the M25. Thirteen-year-old Alicia is about to have surgery after her accident with a lamp post and an E-scooter

programme.title: Top Guns: Inside the RAF
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes - and in the cockpit - with the personnel at RAF Lossiemouth, as global tensions, including with Russia, impact on missions both at home and abroad. In the first episode, RAF pilot Jake Desmond is sent to NATO's frontline to face off against three Russian jets, and rookie pilot Harry Brooks tries to earn his wings and qualify for live operations

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A special celebrity edition in support of Stand Up to Cancer, with Tom Daley and Dustin Lance Black, Charlotte Church and Luke Evans, and Gordon and Tilly Ramsay joining the regular cast. Programmes appraised include The Watcher, I Can See Your Voice, Love Is Blind, Only Connect, personal stories in Channel 4's Stand Up to Cancer strand, and ITV News coverage on the transition of power in Downing Street to Rishi Sunak

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt visits the heart of Texas to help out a retired couple who run a pecan farm. He then travels north and reaches Fort Worth just in time for the world's oldest rodeo and stock show where farmers from 42 states bring their cows, goats, horses and other livestock with hopes of winning a big prize. Matt then heads back into the countryside as he meets one of the state's newest farmers, along with the donkeys and cattle that are helping him become a social media star

programme.title: Becoming Elizabeth
programme.desc: It's a new age with a new Lord Protector, and Edward, now free from his uncle Somerset's influence, is emboldened to pursue ever more ruthless Protestant reforms and to seek new alliances. His sisters are useful tools for the new aims of England, as he decides that they should both get married

programme.title: Becoming Elizabeth
programme.desc: Edward falls deathly ill, and the court that made an enemy of Catholics now face the possibility of being ruled by one as Mary rides to Whitehall. Mary and Elizabeth are briefly reunited in their love for their sick brother, but Edward is distraught that his legacy of a Protestant England dies with him if Mary succeeds to the throne

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week kicks off at Creates Monmouth in Monmouthshire, where a peaceful night's sleep is ruined by an early morning fire alarm and a lack of privacy bothers one guest

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first of five parties from Cheltenham and Gloucester, where dinner party novice Sheree plans to wow her guests with an evening of mythical fantasy and a comprehensive menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Storyteller Chloe is the second to host in Cheltenham and Gloucester, assisted by her cat puppet as she serves up a fairy-tale feast, tall tales and plenty of dragons

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Mike is in charge, and plans to win over his guests by hosting a relaxed evening with no theme and no fancy dress. But how will he cope when Chloe turns up with a surprise guest in tow?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In and around Cheltenham and Gloucester, Dan, the so-called 'King of Critique', presents a British summer time evening event. After a week in which he has been repeatedly criticising the others over their food, he has set himself up with a lot to prove as a host

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In and around Cheltenham and Gloucester, equine events organiser Holly takes her turn as host. However, she soon finds she has some hurdles to overcome. Unhappy with comments on his night, Dan is quick to bicker with Sheree. With their squabbling threatening to dominate Holly's night, it falls to Chloe and Mike to help keep the evening on course

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with more British expats who set up new businesses abroad, revisiting a luxury B&B in Spain as its owners launch a new sideline they hope will turn a profit

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sama Damergi helps Paula Brown to pursue her dream of retiring to the Vendee region of western France. With a budget of £80,000, Paula hopes she will be able to buy a property in which she can keep chickens and grow vegetables

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Gloucestershire couple Helen and Charles Taverner are looking for a holiday home on Lake Como that they can spend some money, time and love on. Sara Damergi leaves no stone unturned showing the couple how far their budget of £50,000 will stretch in this desirable part of Italy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal trainer Eve Booth hosts the first dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, expressing concern that her starter of haggis and black pudding may not be to everyone's taste. Although her main course gets a lukewarm reception, the biggest threat to the evening seems to be fellow contestant Ken Brown's taste in jokes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer and gypsy wedding supplier Paula Thompson hosts the second party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to bring a touch of class to the proceedings with her 'black and bling' themed event. The evening's menu includes fresh lobster and hairy prawns, accompanied by a spot of belly dancing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old languages student Donal Anand-Shaw hosts the third dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and decides to make the event black tie. He also arranges for a string quartet to play, and serves up a locally-sourced scallop starter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debt collector Eleri Watson hosts the fourth dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside. However, her efforts to organise an all-Welsh evening do not go according to plan when soil is found in the leek soup and lamb is served burned, dampening the guests' enthusiasm

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businessman Ken Brown hosts the final dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to entertain his guests with a 'wear a wig' themed evening. After annoying his fellow contestants over the past week, he hopes to make amends with his unique entertainment, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps Jane find a holiday home with a sea view on the Portuguese island of Madeira on a budget of £200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman tries to help Dave and Debbie Gough from Swindon, who have been holidaying on the Costa Blanca for 30 years and now want to retire there

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a memorable restoration project in the remote Creuse region of central France. Back in 2003, when Denise Daniel and Doug Ibbs gave up everything in the UK to start a new life abroad, they couldn't have known what was ahead of them. Falling in love with a dilapidated manor house with just four crumbling walls and half a roof, they embarked on a mission to transform it - working day and night, doing everything themselves, year after year - until slowly but surely they created a magnificent edifice out of the ruins they bought off the internet. On the 70th anniversary of the destruction of the original 19th-century building by the German army, the house finally took its finished form

programme.title: A Cotswold Farmshop
programme.desc: Bini currently supplies the service station freezer with nine of her delicious ready-made curries, all made using locally sourced ingredients, but she's keen to add to her range. She's confident that buyer Alex is going to love her chicken Jammu curry but takes a risk, hoping to impress him with a goat version wildcard - a meat she has never cooked with before

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A special celebrity edition in support of Stand Up to Cancer, with Tom Daley and Dustin Lance Black, Charlotte Church and Luke Evans, and Gordon and Tilly Ramsay joining the regular cast. programme.title: Emergency
programme.desc: At King's College Hospital, specialist surgeons need to work quickly to save the foot of 87-year-old June who suffered a severe open ankle fracture when she lost her balance stepping into a taxi. After being involved in a high-speed crash on the M25, Karl is in intensive care being kept alive by a ventilator. At St Mary's, Zoltan prepares to see his children for the first time after his partial leg amputation and 20-year-old motorcyclist Daniil arrives at St George's by air ambulance after a collision with an HGV

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a woman who is in excruciating pain after giving birth by caesarean section just over a week ago. Even morphine is having little effect. A mother rings for help after her toddler has been ill for several days and proves difficult to wake, while a woman with a bad cough and a very high temperature is struggling to breathe

programme.desc: The rivals stay over at Coastal Park Accommodation in Llanelli, where an evening drinks session turns tense when Billy confronts hosts Claire and Tony about their business model

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: After taking pity on a single mother, landlord Ronnie discovered mystery occupants have turned his property into a scrap metal merchants. Brent Council housing enforcement officer Herb discovers 26 labourers living in life-threatening conditions in a single house, while letting agent John tries to find a solution for a tenant living in squalor due to an issue with hoarding

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Ben Reeve from Lewisham Council's Rogue Landlord Unit aims to help Lola, who stopped paying rent 18 months earlier in an effort to get her negligent landlord to deal with her dilapidated flat's many problems. Eviction specialists also come to the aid of Amit, who found himself continuing his late father's battle with a nightmare renter, and 70-year-old landlady Joan, who started receiving unnerving threats from her rent-skipping tenant after she started legal proceedings to get him evicted

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: The efforts of north London landlord Franc to evict a tenant withholding rent payments on a property whose boiler mysteriously stopped working whenever the rent was due, and a tenant with asthma who has been forced to sleep on his sofa for two years in a damp flat. Plus, a landlord owed £7,000 in rent discovers her nightmare is not over when she evicts the tenant and gains access to her property

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Stavros and Emily try to get their house back from squatters, while Margaret attempts to recover the £20,000 she is owed from a letting agent, and Peterborough council find 12 people crammed into a category-one fire hazard house. Documentary series in which cameras follow the victims and villains of the buy-to-let boom

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Landlord Nicholas Parrington discovers a couple are subletting his house, just months after a previous tenant had turned the property into a brothel, while investors in a community centre for children are aghast when squatters move into their building. In Lewisham, the council's Rogue Landlord Unit raids one of their main streets, on the lookout for slum conditions, illegal overcrowding and criminal activities

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The programme follows officers from Derbyshire's road crime unit as they target dealers bringing drugs into the county, with PC Nick Lovatt giving chase after a sighting of a suspected dealer in Derby. At police HQ, the cops receive intelligence about a van travelling towards Derbyshire suspected of carrying a large amount of cash. The Road Crime Unit heads into position to intercept the van and surround it on the motorway

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Derbyshire's Road Crime Unit uses intelligence and surveillance tactics to crack down on suspected drug dealers. The team receives some intelligence about a man suspected of ferrying drugs into the county using a relative's car. After boxing the car to a stop, a struggle breaks out between the driver and road crime cop Nick Lovatt, and the suspect is forcibly cuffed and detained

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Karl is called to an accident involving a driver in his seventies who has reversed into a house and ruptured a gas main. With the elderly man trapped in his car, it's a full-scale emergency for Karl and his colleagues to free the driver and prevent an explosion. On the outskirts of Derby, traffic cop Jason is called to a mystery crash involving a middle-aged woman who has rolled her car on a quiet suburban street. Unsure why or how the accident has occurred, Jason is left gobsmacked when the truth is revealed

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The pubs finally reopen after nearly four months of lockdown and as a result the police prepare for a spike in drink-drive incidents on Derbyshire's roads. Paul investigates a report of a crash involving a car that has gone straight over a roundabout and then been abandoned, while Scott is called to a report of an alleged hit-and-run - which transpires to be the result of a fight between a pub-goers that spiralled out of control and into the path of oncoming motorists

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Sgt Jon Moon and his police dog Kanto follow a trail of broken glass and spilt alcohol, leading to a confrontation with a robber wielding a nasty-looking knife. Elsewhere, a fight in a club ends with one man in handcuffs and another in hospital, Barry Peach plays catch-up as a teenage driver tears up the streets of Skegness, and Jon Peacock detects a whiff of cannabis in a quiet rural village

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers step in to deal with a rowdy reveller when things get out of hand on New Year's Eve in Lincoln city centre, while Suzie Ranyard catches out a motorist who claims he has been driving with a dodgy number plate for 18 years. Jon Moon arrests a shoplifter more than happy to admit to his crime and a young lad discovers how hard it is to pull the wool over the eyes of Jon Peacock

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Brian Conville gives a man a dressing-down for dangerous driving on the school run, and Barry Peach's detective skills come to the fore when he apprehends a fugitive who has been using a false identity. Meanwhile, during an initiative to clamp down on rural crime, officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit find themselves pursuing some stolen tractors

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jacko is shot at by a suspect with a gun and armed police have fractions of a second in order to decide whether to return fire as pellets fly past their ears in the pitch black. Multiple units box in a suspect taxi that is ferrying cocaine and cannabis along the A1, while Spike and the bike team hunt for a man spotted on a quad bike with a gun

programme.title: Pearl Harbor (2001)

Romantic drama, starring Ben Affleck, Josh Hartnett, Kate Beckinsale and Cuba Gooding Jr

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: An ambitious senatorial candidate murders his campaign manager for threatening to expose his secret affair. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Jackie Cooper, Ken Swofford and Tisha Sterling

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A compulsive gambler with a mountain of debts comes up with a plan to make some easy money. He plants a bomb under his wealthy uncle's car in the hope of inheriting a large legacy - but a hit-and-run driver jeopardises the entire scheme and Columbo is soon sniffing around for clues. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Tyne Daly, Greg Evigan and Don S Davis

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A London theatre producer discovers his actress wife is having an affair with her co-star in their latest production. To avoid exposure, the pair murder him and make it look as if his death was an accident. Meanwhile, Columbo is in the city to pick up some tips from Scotland Yard, and sets about uncovering the truth. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Honor Blackman, Richard Basehart and Wilfrid Hyde White

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A scientist is overjoyed when his son follows in his footsteps, receiving widespread acclaim for a revolutionary new theory. When a fellow boffin produces evidence of plagiarism, the ruthless father resorts to murder to save his son from a scandal. But he reckons without the dishevelled detective, who sees through his efforts to make the killing look like the work of burglars. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Jose Ferrer and Lew Ayres

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: An American chess champion fears he is about to be beaten by a superior player from Russia, and decides the only sure-fire way he can avoid defeat is by murdering his opponent. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Laurence Harvey and Jack Kruschen

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A penniless rare-plant collector, desperate for funds to support his expensive hobby, fakes his nephew's kidnapping to get his hands on a trust fund. However, the supposed victim turns up dead, prompting Columbo to take action to unmask the killer. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Bradford Dillman and Ray Milland

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A millionaire art collector is thought to have been killed as the result of a random burglary. However, Columbo is convinced the dead man's nephew committed the crime to avoid being written out of the will, and embarks on a mission to ensnare his suspect. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Ross Martin and Don Ameche

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed by a stolen surveillance drone and the team links it to elusive terrorist Benham Parsa. NCIS joins forces with the Department of Defence to track down the device before it is used for a large-scale attack, but Gibbs is less than pleased that he has to work with his ex-lover Hollis Mann. Meanwhile, McGee hopes he will be granted time off to attend a black-tie gala honouring his girlfriend Delilah. Guest starring Susanna Thompson (Arrow)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Hard-hitting series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department. The team confront an unthinkable crime when they are called in to investigate the murder of a father and his two young children who have been stabbed to death while sleeping

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The officers investigate the death of a reservist Navy Seal surgeon, and are forced to bring along Vance's daughter to help in a highly dangerous mission

programme.title: NCIS

Saul Rubinek, JK Simmons and Sonia Braga guest star alongside Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A reporter accused of causing the deaths of US soldiers in Iraq by revealing confidential information is shot and wounded in New York. The team discovers the gun belonged to one of the dead servicemen, and suspicion soon falls on a disgruntled colleague of the deceased

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green are called to investigate the murder of a grief counsellor who claimed he could communicate with the dead, and discover he was a conman with a host of disgruntled clients, any one of whom might have had a motive for killing him. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.desc: Tony and Ziva disappear while searching for smuggled weapons at a shipyard. McGee tries to get a GPS trace on the missing duo's mobiles, leaving the others struggling to find them before they come to serious harm. Michael Weatherly and Cote de Pablo star

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Newly engaged couple Natasha and Extus from London have £300,000 to spend on their first home together, on St Lucia. Extus grew up there, and Natasha has been in love with the island ever since holidaying there for the first time 15 years ago. They're looking for a home that can also double up as a luxury B&B. Danni Menzies shows them five properties to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: Mel and Steve want to buy a holiday home in south Queensland, Australia that will become their permanent home once they retire. It's a big challenge for Ben Hillman as he sets out to find a property that gives Mel, Steve and Vikki everything they want from their wish-list, on their budget of £220,000

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.title: Border Security: America's Front Line
programme.desc: Reality series charting the work of US Customs and Border Protection agents, responsible for acting as the first line of defence for air, sea and land entry-points to the US

programme.title: Border Security: America's Front Line

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Another edition of the fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports, following customs and immigration officers as they go about their daily business of tackling drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Another edition of the fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports, following customs and immigration officers as they go about their daily business of tackling drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: The team tries to track down a man who possesses binoculars that saw the Hiroshima blast and has been killing anyone who upsets a girl he went to school with

programme.title: Quantum Leap
programme.desc: Sam assumes the body of a blind concert pianist in the 1960s and must save his assistant from being murdered by her stalker. Scott Bakula stars

programme.title: Merlin
programme.desc: A year after her disappearance, Morgana returns to Camelot, where a delighted Uther immediately announces a banquet in her honour. However, when evil magic begins to take hold of the king's mind, Merlin suspects the lady is hiding a sinister secret, only for the wizard's search for the truth to leave him at the mercy of the scorpion-like enchanted serkets. Colin Morgan and Katie McGrath star

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: Part two of two. Janeway and her team endeavour to set the drones free and infiltrate the Borg Cube using special implants, but the Queen will go to any length to prevent her minions regaining their individuality. Tuvok falls prey to the Collective mind and the rest of the group is captured. Sci-fi drama, starring Susanna Thompson and Kate Mulgrew

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team hunt for a sniper after a petty officer is shot dead and find that the shooter may not have been acting alone. Rita tells Pride that she has been offered a job in Kansas City

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: Nolan's life is complicated by an unannounced visit from his mother, and Sgt Grey announces he wants to retire. Cop drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Frances Fisher

programme.title: Alphas
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sci-fi drama about a team of superhumans. The Alphas investigate the shooting of a suspect at New York Police Headquarters. However, when inquiries lead them to a minor-league baseball player who has received orders to kill, they wonder whether the culprit could be one of their own. Sci-fi drama, starring David Strathairn, Laura Mennell and Ryan Cartwright

programme.title: Snapped
programme.desc: When a family dispute results in a death, detectives trawl through a list of suspects and find the woman at the centre of the crime

programme.title: Murders That Shocked The Nation
programme.desc: Author Fred Dinenage, who conducted a series of interviews with the Kray twins for their autobiography, recounts the time he spent with them and presents their true story

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: The hunt is on for a missing schoolboy, a man suspected of assault collapses in the custody suite and a pensioner vanishes after a night out

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at an Immigration Removal Centre, where the UK Border Agency is preparing to implement a mass deportation aboard a specially chartered flight. Meanwhile, officers in London investigate the home of a Chinese takeaway owner, and Steve Hassler's final case before leaving for another job proves to be particularly difficult
