programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Staff Nurse Rachel prepares to hand-rear two kittens for the next 12 weeks, hoping that by then an adoptive family will be found. New vet Aisling makes her first house call. An emergency call is made to the cat hospital after cat Jessie is hit by a truck

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: Europe's Wilderness
programme.desc: A journey of discovery to a wonderful world of breath-taking views and endangered species with each episode focusing on one animal and its lifestyle, needs and habitat

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits the three island outposts of Shetland, Papa Stour, Whalsay and Out Skerries. He encounters newborn lambs and watches a traditional sword dance, before taking a trip on a trawler. He discovers how the islands have developed their own sense of community in the face of declining populations and the challenges of a remote location

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton heads to the northernmost spur of Skye, the Trotternish Peninsula, which has a distinct identity of its own - almost as if it were an island within an island. He begins his adventure at one of the star attractions of this part of the island, the Old Man of Storr and his journey into the geological past sees him follow in the footsteps of the dinosaurs who once walked this land

programme.title: The Bulldog Breed (1960)
programme.desc: A bumbling grocer is rejected by the woman of his dreams, plunging him into misery. He decides to get over his heartbreak by joining the Navy, and despite his ineptitude, is selected by an admiral to become Britain's first astronaut. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Ian Hunter, David Lodge and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: A Tale of Two Cities (1935)
programme.desc: A disreputable English lawyer helps a French aristocrat overcome charges of treason, but finds himself falling for the man's fiancee. Adaptation of Dickens' classic novel set during the bloodshed of the French Revolution, starring Ronald Colman, Elizabeth Allan, Donald Woods and Basil Rathbone

programme.title: Terry on the Fence (1986)
programme.desc: A teenage runaway becomes involved with a tough street gang while trying to find a way to redeem himself. Crime drama, starring Jack McNicoll and Neville Watson

programme.title: Break Out (1984)
programme.desc: Two boys on a birdwatching trip are forced to help two escaped convicts to evade the law. Children's adventure, starring David Jackson and Ian Bartholomew

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Camberwell and Mottingham for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Commander Koenig and the crew encounter an astonishing being whose attempt to contact Commander the Alphans unwittingly places them in danger. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: A poacher is drowned by a freak rainstorm, alerting Steed and Mrs Peel to the sinister activities of a criminal mastermind intent on creating mayhem by controlling the weather. Diana Rigg and Patrick Macnee star

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: Series in which families reveal the moment their lives changed forever - when they were told their missing loved ones had been murdered

programme.title: Care
programme.desc: One-off drama by Jimmy McGovern and Gillian Juckes, starring Sheridan Smith as single mother Jenny, who is able to support her two children owing to the constant childcare support of her own mother Mary (Alison Steadman). However, their lives are thrown into chaos when Mary suffers a stroke and develops dementia, requiring full-time care herself and leaving Jenny torn between her responsibilities

programme.title: Nineteen Nineteen (1985)
programme.desc: Two former patients of Sigmund Freud meet again and discuss the psychiatric treatment they underwent 65 years earlier. Period drama, starring Paul Scofield and Maria Schell

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: Sequel to The Comic Strip Presents: Five Go Mad in Dorset, made 30 years later to celebrate its anniversary. The young heroes have now grown up, but Dick in particular remains out of touch with the modern world. Anne is teetering on the edge of a nervous breakdown, while George is struggling to stay off alcohol. Julian shares George's drink problem - as well as having a couple of shady characters on his tail. Adrian Edmondson, Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders and Peter Richardson star

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring Canary Wharf and Southbank

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Families
programme.desc: Unique families from around the world who live their lives in a less than conventional way

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: A journey through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering's assistant, David Marlowe, is abducted from the shop and a ransom demanded for his return

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: The harsh winter of 1947 pushes British industry ever closer to the edge, and Rita is forced to close the hairdressing business

programme.title: Italy Made With Love
programme.desc: While Puglia may be off-the-beaten path for some tourists, many travellers know that some of the most amazing crafts and the best food can be found down at the heel of Italy's famous boot

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: Yvonne is left shattered by an embarrassing experience, while Gary and Phoebe tangle with thugs running a protection racket, and Ron finds life without Flic unbearable. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and Elizabeth Carling

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Crystal Palace and Shoreditch. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The Keeper of the Well of Small Blessings tries to make Tripitaka drink magic water in a bid to regain both her youth and her lost lover, while Pigsy and Sandy end up pregnant

programme.title: A Tale of Two Cities (1935)
programme.desc: A disreputable English lawyer helps a French aristocrat overcome charges of treason, but finds himself falling for the man's fiancee. Adaptation of Dickens' classic novel set during the bloodshed of the French Revolution, starring Ronald Colman, Elizabeth Allan, Donald Woods and Basil Rathbone

programme.title: Terry on the Fence (1986)
programme.desc: A teenage runaway becomes involved with a tough street gang while trying to find a way to redeem himself. Crime drama, starring Jack McNicoll and Neville Watson

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Commander Koenig and the crew encounter an astonishing being whose attempt to contact Commander the Alphans unwittingly places them in danger. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Europe's Wilderness
programme.desc: A journey of discovery to a wonderful world of breath-taking views and endangered species with each episode focusing on one animal and its lifestyle, needs and habitat

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie reunites with former Sunshine Desserts colleagues Joan, CJ, Tony and David - but this time things are very different. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Between Two Women (2000)
programme.desc: Emotionally intense British kitchen-sink drama, set in the post-war period. Barbara Marten stars as a housewife stuck in an unhappy marriage, whose only pleasure is her devotion to her artistically gifted son. However, her life takes an unexpected turn when she meets the boy's female teacher, and an unexpected and passionate romance develops. Andrew Dunn, Frank Windsor and Andrina Carroll also star

programme.title: Too Late (2015)
programme.desc: A private eye is hired to track down a missing woman with a connection to his own troubled past. The search leads him on a journey through the seedy underworld of Los Angeles, and into a series of encounters with lost souls and eccentric personalities. Detective drama, starring John Hawkes and Jeff Fahey

programme.title: The Man in the Glass Booth (1975)
programme.desc: A rich Jewish industrialist is stunned to find himself abducted and taken to Israel, where he is accused of being a Nazi war criminal _ could the allegation be true? Searing drama adapted from Robert Shaw's acclaimed play, starring Maximilian Schell, Lois Nettleton, Luther Adler and Lawrence Pressman

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tour of West Greenwich for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: Squabbling and ego-clashes erupt between a quartet of seasoned sales professionals flying to a conference. Comedy, starring Rik Mayall, Peter Richardson, Adrian Edmondson and Nigel Planer

programme.title: Blitz Spirit
programme.desc: Documentary series offering an insight into life for Londoners during the Blitz, which left much of the capital destroyed and claimed 30,000 lives, widening the gulf between rich and poor. The programme features personal testimony from people who lived through the period, and reveals how government information films and the Press played down much of the devastation. Narrated by Christopher Timothy

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering's assistant, David Marlowe, is abducted from the shop and a ransom demanded for his return

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Families
programme.desc: What exactly makes a family in today's often complex world? Each episode features three unique families from around the world who live their lives in a less than conventional way!

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering and Cordelia meet Peter Franklin, an American undercover agent. He has stolen a strain of a deadly germ warfare virus from the laboratory where he was secretly working

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Erich Gottlieb continues to give Harvey the cold shoulder. Period comedy drama, starring Kenneth Cranham, Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: A poacher is drowned by a freak rainstorm, alerting Steed and Mrs Peel to the sinister activities of a criminal mastermind intent on creating mayhem by controlling the weather. Diana Rigg and Patrick Macnee star

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: Gary must prevent a photograph of him in 1940 coming to light in the present and exposing his double life. Nicholas Lyndhurst stars

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie reunites with former Sunshine Desserts colleagues Joan, CJ, Tony and David - but this time things are very different. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: Woman in a Dressing Gown (1957)
programme.desc: A man grows tired of his marriage and asks his wife for a divorce so he can marry his lover - but begins to regret abandoning his family. Drama, with Anthony Quayle and Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Life For Ruth (1962)
programme.desc: A doctor tries to have a man who refused to allow his dying daughter to be given a blood transfusion prosecuted for manslaughter. Drama, starring Patrick McGoohan and Michael Craig

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: A fire becomes uncontrollable and threatens to spread in the Glen Garriff lions reserve. Andi visits her family in the city and as financial difficulties get worse, she must make a heartbreaking decision

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Auschwitz in 33 Objects
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind the personal items and belongings left behind in Auschwitz Birkenau, a former nazi concentration and extermination camp, the world's largest cemetery and resting place. Part 3 of 5.

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits North Uist in the Outer Hebrides, where he goes scuba-diving to explore the underwater world of Loch nam Madadh, the largest saltwater feature of its kind on the island. Ray also admires the wildlife populating its shores, including diving and wading birds, sea eagles, red deer, otters and common seals

programme.title: Top Tens of Warfare
programme.desc: The documentary explores how war has proven that necessity is the mother of invention, with Penicillin, plastic surgery and even the internet having origins in times of conflict

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: Series in which families reveal the moment their lives changed forever - when they were told their missing loved ones had been murdered

programme.title: Vita & Virginia (2019)
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. The pair meet in London in the 1920s and, despite both of them being married, they embark on an affair that later inspired one of Virginia's novels. Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini

programme.title: Poor Cow (1967)
programme.desc: A young mother lives in squalor with her good-for-nothing husband. Kitchen-sink drama directed by Ken Loach, starring Carol White and Terence Stamp

programme.title: Too Late (2015)
programme.desc: A private eye is hired to track down a missing woman with a connection to his own troubled past. The search leads him on a journey through the seedy underworld of Los Angeles, and into a series of encounters with lost souls and eccentric personalities. Detective drama, starring John Hawkes and Jeff Fahey

programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Scrapheap Challenge
programme.desc: Gina Campbell, former holder of the women's water speed record, judges as motocross enthusiasts the Somerset Scramblers and Berkshire-based the Rusty Regiment are challenged to build souped-up powerboats. The vessels must be capable of breaking the show's hit-and-miss record for wave-pounding speeds on water - last attempted by competitors who were embarrassingly overtaken by a duck

programme.title: Scrapheap Challenge
programme.desc: The Brum Brums from Birmingham and the Aquarium Crew from Weymouth do battle to see who can build the best super-fast trains, using methods inspired by US Air Force rocket sleds. However, the teams are not allowed to send drive to the wheels, so normal forms of propulsion, such as chain and sprockets and propshafts, are prohibited. Presented by Robert Llewellyn and Lisa Rogers

programme.title: Scrapheap Challenge
programme.desc: The Crash Bang Clan, a family of Scottish car enthusiasts, and the Bristol-based Super Models are given 10 hours to construct makeshift fire engines capable of navigating a complex obstacle course before extinguishing two burning mock jet engines

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five university friends known as 'The Medicine Men' answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: TV presenter Adrian Chiles, former Hollyoaks star Gemma Merna (Carmel Valentine), Holby City's Rosie Marcel (Jac Naylor) and broadcaster Jon Snow compete to win thousands of pounds for charity by taking on one of the show's resident trivia experts in a test of their general knowledge. However, they must work as a team to build their prize pot and stay one step ahead of the Chaser. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: EFL Cup Retro
programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur in the 2008/09 final. Spurs were managed by Harry Redknapp and had a strong run that led them to the final of the competition, having beaten the likes of Newcastle, Liverpool and Watford in previous rounds. The Red Devils had beaten Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Blackburn Rovers in the early rounds, before beating Derby County 4-3 on aggregate

programme.title: The Hundred Live
programme.desc: Northern Superchargers Men v Welsh Fire Men. Live coverage of the match from Headingley, Leeds. The visitors won this meeting last year with a comprehensive six-wicket victory in Cardiff. The hosts could only make 114-4 from their 100 hundred balls, with England opener Ben Duckett top scoring with 64 not out. In reply the Superchargers reached their target with nine balls to spare thanks to Adam Lyth's 47 from 34 balls
